0.title: TN minister's daughter seeks B'luru Police's protection for self, husband
0.article_body: Jayakalyani, the daughter of Tamil Nadu minister and DMK leader PK Sekar Babu, has sought protection from Bengaluru Police for herself and her husband Satish Kumar. She alleged her family is against their relationship and had got Satish arrested earlier when they tried getting married. "I suspect...my father [is] behind this," she said, adding that they got death threats too.

1.title: Kohli played 2011 WC semi against Pakistan despite neck and jaw pain: Ex-India physio
1.article_body: Former Team India physio Ashish Kaushik has revealed that Virat Kohli played the 2011 World Cup semi-final against Pakistan in Mohali despite neck and jaw pain. Kaushik added, "Kohli would take everything extremely lightly and somehow know...he can work through it." "His pain tolerance is phenomenal...Kohli has got a tremendous ability to endure pain and look for solutions," he stated.

2.title: M&A in their early days: Harsh Goenka as he shares childhood pic of Ambani brothers
2.article_body: RPG Enterprises Chairman Harsh Goenka has shared a childhood photograph of Mukesh Ambani and Anil Ambani on Twitter and wrote, "Two brothers in their early days...M&A." The picture shows the two brothers dressed in formal suits with garlands around their necks. "Mukesh Ambani's looks are always constant," a Twitter user reacted to the picture.

3.title: Dog peed right by me as I celebrated Best Actor award win: Nakuul
3.article_body: Nakuul Mehta, who bagged the Best Actor-Television award for his show 'Bade Achhe Lagte Hain 2', at the Indian Television Awards 2022, said he celebrated his win by having kathi roll on the streets of Mumbai. "Whilst a passing stray dog, peed right by me. Gentle reminder by...universe that...the world may still not give a shit about you," he added.

4.title: Edtech unicorn Emeritus raises $350 million from CPP Investments
4.article_body: Edtech unicorn Emeritus has raised $350 million in debt financing from Canada Pension Plan Investment Board through its subsidiary CPPIB Credit Investments. After the funding's completion, Emeritus claims that it will have raised more than $1 billion in debt and equity. CPP Investments also participated in Emeritus' $650 million funding last year, which pushed Emeritus' valuation to $3.2 billion.

5.title: 70-year-old man found dead at home in UP's Greater Noida
5.article_body: A 70-year-old man was found dead at his home in Habibpur village in Uttar Pradesh's Greater Noida on Monday morning, police said. "Prima facie it appears that the man was strangulated. However, a post mortem report will confirm the cause of death," police added. The victim was involved in a property dispute with some relatives, police further said.

6.title: David Warner does bhangra on field during match against Pakistan, video goes viral
6.article_body: A video of Australia opener David Warner doing bhangra on the field during first Test against Pakistan in Rawalpindi has gone viral. "The crowd and the camera love Warner," the official account of Pakistan Cricket tweeted sharing the video. "Some entertainment in boring dead Test match," a fan commented on the video.

7.title: Unbelievably moved: Kristen Stewart on her 1st Oscar nomination
7.article_body: Actress Kristen Stewart has said that she was unbelievably moved after receiving an Oscar nomination for her film 'Spencer'. "I am truly astounded and unbelievably moved and touched and just stunned," she stated. Kristen has been nominated in the Best Actress category for her role as Princess Diana in the film. Kristen added that she loved the film.

8.title: Pune Metro trains to get dedicated ladies' coach 'Nari Shakti'
8.article_body: Pune Metro will soon run three-coach trains with a dedicated ladies' compartment called 'Nari Shakti', said Hemant Sonawne, Public Relation Officer of Pune Metro. The coaches will be equipped with CCTV cameras, charging sockets, air conditioning and emergency buttons, which will connect a passenger directly to loco pilot and station control room. The fares will be between ₹10-₹20, Sonawne added.

9.title: Delhi's maximum temperature likely to rise up to 34°C over next 6 days
9.article_body: The maximum temperature in Delhi will see a further rise in the next six days, the India Meteorological Department has said. The temperature is likely to rise up to about 32°C on March 13 and to 34°C by the next day. IMD said that the city is likely to record a high of 30°C on Tuesday.

10.title: Bengaluru bans protests near colleges, schools till March 22 amid hijab row
10.article_body: Amid the ongoing hijab controversy, Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant has extended the ban on protests and gatherings within the 200-metre radius of schools, colleges, and other educational institutions till March 22. This is important to maintain public peace and order in Bengaluru, Pant said, adding the issue is still alive. The ban was first imposed on February 9.

11.title: Exit polls tactic to create mental pressure: RLD chief
11.article_body: Rashtriya Lok Dal (RLD) chief Jayant Chaudhary on Tuesday rejected exit poll predictions that said BJP will retain power in Uttar Pradesh. "I do not agree with...exit poll process," he told ANI. "The exit polls are an attempt to create mental pressure. It's a way to demoralise the people who want a change in the state," Chaudhary added.

12.title: Revenue Secy urges Customs officials to be cautious amid rise in drug hauls
12.article_body: Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj on Monday urged officials of the Customs department to be cautious amid rise in drug hauls across the country. "The change in the geopolitical situation may actually see that we are getting more quantity than what we were getting earlier," Bajaj said during an investiture ceremony organised by the Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs.

13.title: Rapper-YouTuber Lil Bo Weep dies aged 22, father says 'She couldn't fight anymore'
13.article_body: Australian rapper-YouTuber Lil Bo Weep has died aged 22, her father Matthew Schofield confirmed in a Facebook post. "We lost the fight for my daughter's life against depression, trauma, PTSD and drug addiction that we have been fighting since we got her back from America through emergency repatriation DFAT but broken," he wrote. "She could not fight anymore," he added.

14.title: We were all saying Ashwin is struggling, his career is probably over: Sodhi
14.article_body: Talking about Ravichandran Ashwin becoming India's second-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket, ex-India all-rounder Reetinder Singh Sodhi said, "We were all saying that Ashwin is struggling, his career is probably over but that's not the case." "Anil Kumble has been my idol, so I'd want...Ashwin doesn't break his record [of 619 Test wickets]," added Reetinder. Ashwin has taken 436 Test wickets.

15.title: Domestic help jumps from 5th floor of building in Bandra, dies
15.article_body: A 30-year-old domestic help, Sarita Toko, jumped to her death from the fifth floor of a building in Mumbai's Bandra on Sunday. Toko hails from Jharkhand and had started working at a flat on the fifth floor last week. Her employers learnt of the incident only after a newspaper delivery person found her body in the compound, police said.

16.title: Nickel price more than doubles in a day, briefly hits $100,000 a tonne
16.article_body: Nickel price jumped as much as 111% on Tuesday to briefly surge above a record $100,000/tonne on London Metal Exchange (LME), before paring some gains. LME halted trading in nickel as brokers faced trouble in paying margin calls following the largest-ever price move on the exchange. This comes amid a rise in risk of shortages from Russia, following Ukraine's invasion.

17.title: Duplantis breaks his own pole vault world record for 2nd time in 2 years
17.article_body: Armand Duplantis of Sweden has set a new pole vault world record of 6.19 metres at the World Athletics Indoor Tour event in Belgrade, Serbia. This is the second time in two years that Duplantis has improved his own record by 1cm. In February 2020, he had broken his own record of 6.17 metres with a 6.18 metres clearance.

18.title: Geeta praises Virat for having Anushka next to him on 100th Test felicitation
18.article_body: Cricketer Harbhajan Singh's wife Geeta Basra spoke about Anushka Sharma being present on the ground when Virat Kohli was felicitated on his 100th Test match. She lauded Virat for having Anushka next to him and said he is changing rules. "It was...first time a cricketer's wife was next to her husband when he was being honoured on field," Geeta said.

19.title: 7 students from Pune district yet to return from Ukraine
19.article_body: Seven more students from Maharashtra's Pune district are yet to return from Ukraine as on Monday as three of them are in Poland, one is in Oman and three students are in transit. As many as 102 students from the district have been brought back. Pune District Collector Rajesh Deshmukh said the administration is in touch with the students.

20.title: Assam man burns wife alive for failing to meet dowry demands; held
20.article_body: A 40-year-old man allegedly burnt his wife alive in Moina in Assam's Karimganj district after her family failed to meet his demands for dowry, police said on Tuesday. The accused, Jamal Uddin, married the victim, Khudeja Begum, after his first wife left him and remarried. Begum used to live with her parents due to Uddin's dowry demands.

21.title: Shortfall of 19,128 classrooms in state-run schools: Gujarat Min
21.article_body: Responding to a set of questions raised by Congress MLAs, Gujarat Education Minister Jitu Vaghani informed the House that there was a shortfall of 19,128 classrooms in various state-run primary schools as of December 2021. The Gujarat government has also built 2,714 new classrooms during the last two years, Vaghani added. Dahod district topped the list of classrooms' shortfall.

22.title: India's economy picking up pace, reflecting reforms of our govt: PM Modi
22.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that India's economy is picking up pace after the COVID-19 pandemic and it is reflecting the fundamentals and reforms of the BJP-led Central government. "By encouraging foreign capital flows, reducing tax on infrastructure investment, creating institutions like NIIF, Gift City, new DFIs, we've tried to accelerate financial and economic growth," PM added.

23.title: Spoke to Warne 2 days before he went to Thailand, we planned to meet: Clarke
23.article_body: Ex-Australia captain Michael Clarke has said he talked to Shane Warne two days before he got on the plane for Thailand, where he died aged 52. "We spoke briefly about trying to get fit...the plan was...I would go and see him, he bought a new car, we both love cars. That's why it was an absolute shock," revealed Clarke.

24.title: Sanctions on India over Russian deal would be extraordinarily foolhardy: US politician
24.article_body: US Senator Ted Cruz responded to reports that Joe Biden-led US administration is contemplating to impose Countering America's Adversaries through Sanctions Act (CAATSA) against India over purchase of S-400 missile system from Russia. "Imposing CAATSA sanctions against India, the largest democracy on Earth...would be extraordinarily foolhardy," he said, adding that India is a critical ally.

25.title: I do therapy once a week, want to tell my younger self to relax: Alia Bhatt
25.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt, in recent interview with journalist Barkha Dutt, said she goes to therapy once a week. "I am in the film industry and have been very hard on myself with regards to food and weight. I would tell my 18, 19, 20 year old self 'Just relax, put effort but don't be so hard on yourself'," she added.

26.title: Amazon's Chinese suppliers linked to forced labour camps: Report
26.article_body: Amazon's public list of Chinese suppliers includes five companies previously linked directly or indirectly to forced labour of ethnic minorities from China's Xinjiang region, Tech Transparency Project reported. The suppliers help produce Amazon-branded devices and products sold under house labels like Amazon Basics. Two of the suppliers named in the report were also reportedly used by Apple.

27.title: PMC presents draft budget of ₹8,592 cr, focus on more road networks
27.article_body: Pune Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar on Monday presented the civic body's draft budget of ₹8,592 crore for 2022-23, with a focus on creating more road networks in city. "Despite...Pune Metro being launched, we want to strengthen...public transport...Considering this, I have proposed six more...flyovers...and one bridge,” Kumar said. Many projects will be implemented via PPP model, he added.

28.title: Ashram underpass to be open from March 22: Delhi Deputy CM
28.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Monday said the Ashram underpass will be opened for the public from March 22 onwards. Sisodia recently also carried out an inspection of the construction site. Another underpass at Pragati Maidan will be ready for use by May while construction of the Ashram flyover will be completed by August, PTI quoted Sisodia as saying.

29.title: Huge rush of passengers on Pune Metro on 2nd day, pics surface
29.article_body: The newly operational Pune Metro witnessed a good turnout on the second day on Monday and a huge rush of people was seen in metro stations. The metro is operational on two routes-- from Garware college to Vanaz station and from Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation to Phugewadi. The facility is open to the public from 8 am to 9 pm.

30.title: Mumbai man jumps in front of train with son over joblessness; child dies
30.article_body: A Mumbai-based 32-year-old man reportedly tried to kill himself along with his three-year-old son by jumping in front of a train on Sunday. However, he survived the jump, but his son died. He was reportedly unemployed and often landed up in an argument with his wife over the same. Following this, he decided to end his life with his son.

31.title: Speeding dumper truck mows down woman on way to church in Mumbai
31.article_body: A 65-year-old woman died after a speeding dumper truck mowed her down in Mumbai's Malad on Sunday. The victim, Aliana Thomas, was on her way to the church when the incident happened. Reportedly, the driver, Mohammad Shafiq Ansari, lost control of the vehicle and hit Thomas who was walking on the roadside. She succumbed to her injuries during the treatment.

32.title: Leonardo DiCaprio donates $10 million for his grandmother's native land Ukraine
32.article_body: Hollywood actor Leonardo DiCaprio has donated $10 million to support Ukraine, which is fighting against Russia. The actor's maternal grandmother, Helene Indenbirken, was born in Odessa as Jelena Stepanovna Smirnova, as per Polish News. In 1917, she emigrated from there with her parents to Germany, where DiCaprio's mother was born.

33.title: Kuldeep Yadav released from India squad for pink-ball Test, Axar Patel returns
33.article_body: Chinaman bowler Kuldeep Yadav has been released from India squad for the pink-ball Test against Sri Lanka scheduled to take place from March 12 in Bengaluru. All-rounder Axar Patel has been added to India squad after being cleared by BCCI's medical team. Axar recently recovered from a shin injury and COVID-19.

34.title: We both went bald: Zerodha Co-founder's wife on their pic amid her chemotherapy
34.article_body: Zerodha Co-founder Nithin Kamath's wife Seema Patil, who was recently diagnosed with breast cancer and is undergoing chemotherapy, said she decided not to go for a wig as cancer's already a "taboo". "It...didn't feel right...so, we both went bald at the same time. Nithin has agreed to remain bald until my hair grows back again," she wrote, sharing their picture.

35.title: 9 killed after Russian aircraft bombed residential buildings in Sumy: Ukraine
35.article_body: At least nine people, including two children, have been killed after Russian aircraft bombed residential buildings in the Ukrainian city of Sumy on Monday night, Ukraine's State Emergency Service said. Several people have also been injured in the airstrikes in Sumy, which is near the Russian border. Russian aircraft also bombed cities in central Ukraine and destroyed buildings, officials said.

36.title: Pic shows 12-yr-old holding her crying sister while leaving mother behind in Ukraine
36.article_body: A picture showing a 12-year-old girl holding her crying sister as she waves their mother goodbye in Ukraine has surfaced online. "Alexandra, 12, holds her sister Esyea, 6, who cries as she waves at her mother Irina, while members of the Jewish community of Odessa board a bus to flee Russia's invasion of Ukraine, in Odessa, Ukraine," a journalist tweeted.

37.title: Over 75% of Amazon forest struggling to recover from wildfires, droughts: Study
37.article_body: Satellite images collected over the last two decades have found that over 75% of Amazon rainforest are likely struggling to recover from extreme climatic events like droughts, wildfires and logging among others. The study published in Nature Climate Change journal also stated that the rainforest may be nearing a "tipping point" of dieback, where the rainforest will turn to savanna.

38.title: Ukraine claims 12,000 Russian soldiers killed; 128 aircraft, 303 tanks destroyed
38.article_body: Ukraine on Tuesday claimed that it has killed around 12,000 Russian soldiers since the Russian invasion began on February 24. Ukraine also claimed that its military has destroyed 303 Russian tanks and over 120 aircraft including 80 helicopters and 48 planes. It also claimed to have destroyed 1,036 armoured personnel carriers, 120 artillery systems and 56 multiple launch rocket systems.

39.title: Ukraine's 'Don't mess with our farmers' video goes viral amid war
39.article_body: A video titled 'Don't mess with Ukrainian farmers' posted by the country on its official Twitter account amid Russian invasion has gone viral. In the video, Ukrainian farmers can be seen towing away Russian defence equipment including tanks with tractors. "Probably it is a bit embarrassing for the 'greatest army of the world' to lose to Ukrainian farmers," Ukraine said.

40.title: Odisha's Ganjam district tops list with highest jobs under MGNREGA
40.article_body: Odisha's Ganjam district topped the list in providing employment under the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA). According to officials, till Monday, over 1 lakh households in the district were provided at least 100-day work in financial year 2021-22. Ganjam was followed by Rajasthan's Barmer and Nagaur, wherein 94,586 and 82,731 households respectively received work.

41.title: Man kills brother, uncle over property dispute in Kerala’s Kottayam; held
41.article_body: A 52-year-old man was arrested on Monday for allegedly killing his younger brother and their uncle during a fight over a family property dispute in Kerala’s Kottayam district, police said. According to the police, trouble surfaced in the family after the accused man got two-and-a-half acres of family property registered under his name.

42.title: Govt will keep focusing on women empowerment: PM Modi on Women's Day
42.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi took to Twitter to extend greetings on International Women's Day and said government will keep focusing on women empowerment through its various schemes. "From financial inclusion to social security, quality healthcare to housing, education to entrepreneurship, many efforts have been made to put our Nari Shakti at the forefront of India's development," he tweeted.

43.title: Over 2,600 cases related to sexual assault pending in forensic labs: Maha Min
43.article_body: Responding to a question raised by Pradnya Satav in the Assembly, Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil said that more than 2,600 cases related to sexual assault were pending with the state forensic laboratories. As of January 2022, 1,619 cases related to sexual assault on children and 1,052 cases related to sexual assault on women were pending, the minister informed.

44.title: RBI launches 24/7 helpline 'DigiSaathi' for digital payment queries
44.article_body: The RBI has launched a 24x7 helpline for digital payments queries, DigiSaathi. The initiative will help customers address digital payments queries including cards, and the most relevant and appropriate information will be delivered as soon as possible. RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das also launched an instant payment system "UPI 123PAY" for feature phone users.

45.title: I was the only one in family rooting for a girl right from the start: Aditya
45.article_body: Singer Aditya Narayan, who recently welcomed baby girl with wife Shweta Agarwal, has named his daughter Twisha and said he was only one in the family "rooting for a girl from the start". "Twisha is a Sanskrit word. It means 'Rays Of Light'. My father's name Udit, my name Aditya and now my daughter Twisha are all light-related," he added.

46.title: We fought as hard as we could, will wait for results: Priyanka on UP exit polls
46.article_body: As exit polls predicted a return to power for BJP in UP, Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi on Tuesday said that the Congress party will wait for the results. "We fought as hard as we could. We will wait and see the results," Gandhi added. For UP, NewsX and Republic P-Marq exit polls predicted over 200 seats for the BJP.

47.title: Ajay Devgn calls himself Veena's son, Kajol's husband in Women's Day post
47.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn took to Instagram to share a post on occasion of Women's Day on Tuesday. He shared a clip that showed his name being struck out. The clip further reads, "Veena's son, Kavita and Neelam's brother, Kajol's husband, Nysa's father." He captioned the post saying, "Thank you all for shaping me in the most wonderful way."

48.title: India has set a target of net-zero carbon emissions by 2070: PM Modi
48.article_body: Speaking at a webinar on 'Financing for Growth and Aspirational Economy', Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that India has set a target of net-zero carbon emissions by 2070. "To speed up work on this, it's necessary to accelerate environment-friendly projects," he added. "Green Financing...study of such new aspects and implementation is the need of the hour," PM stated.

49.title: Senior al-Qaeda leader killed in overnight raid in Mali: France
49.article_body: French Army on Monday announced that its forces in Mali have killed a senior regional leader of al-Qaeda in an overnight raid on February 25-26. Yahia Djouadi, a former "emir" of Al-Qaeda's Libyan operations, was responsible for finance and logistics for the group in Africa's Sahel region, French Army said, adding, the killing "once again weakens al-Qaeda's governance" in Mali.

50.title: It took so many tears & so much therapy: Anshula on her weight-loss journey
50.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor's sister Anshula Kapoor shared a post on her weight loss journey on Monday. Anshula wrote, "One of my first steps to becoming a healthier me was to acknowledge that mentally I wasn't in the best place. It took so much therapy. So many tears...It's been a two-year-long journey, and I'm still a work in progress."

51.title: Our startups can grow only when we encourage entrepreneurship: PM
51.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that our startups can grow only when we encourage entrepreneurship and focus on new business areas. "The financing sector needs to look at new futuristic ideas, innovative financing of initiatives and sustainable risk management," PM Modi added while addressing a webinar on 'Financing for Growth and Aspirational Economy'.

52.title: Cricket couple Starc, Healy bat simultaneously in respective Aus-Pak matches, fans react
52.article_body: Cricket couple Mitchell Starc and Alyssa Healy were on Tuesday batting simultaneously in their respective Australia-Pakistan matches. While Starc was batting against Pakistan in the first Test in Rawalpindi, Healy was batting against Pakistan in their Women's World Cup match. "What a coincidence," a fan tweeted, while another wrote, "It could be the very first such incident in cricketing history."

53.title: I'm the healthiest person I know & I got breast cancer: Zerodha Co-founder's wife
53.article_body: Zerodha Co-founder Nithin Kamath's wife Seema Patil has revealed in a blog that she was diagnosed with breast cancer in November 2021 despite being "the healthiest and fittest person" she knew. "The last few months...have been a blur and an emotional roller coaster. As cliché as it may sound, health really is wealth," Patil, who's Zerodha's whole-time director, wrote.

54.title: BJP will seek alliance with MGP if necessary: Goa CM Pramod Sawant
54.article_body: Ahead of the assembly election results, Goa CM Pramod Sawant said BJP is optimistic that it will win more than 22 seats, however, if the party falls short of the number, then it will seek support from the independents and Maharashtrawadi Gomantak Party (MGP). "The central BJP leadership is in talks with MGP for a post-poll alliance," Sawant told PTI.

55.title: My dad is in a tough battle: Pele's son Edinho on his fight with cancer
55.article_body: Discussing his father and Brazilian football legend Pele's fight against cancer, Edinho said, "He's in a tough battle...but my father is a fighter, just as he has been his whole life." "We're hoping that he'll recover," said Edinho. Pele is the first man to score 1,000 goals in competitive football having recorded the feat in November 1969.

56.title: RCB to announce their new captain on March 12 at Bengaluru's Church Street
56.article_body: Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) will announce their new captain on March 12 at an event at Bengaluru's Church Street. "The beginning of a new era of leadership requires a BIG stage," RCB tweeted while announcing the event. RCB are the only team remaining to announce their captain for IPL 2022, which will begin on March 26.

57.title: I have saved 2,305 lives through concerts: 'Laapata' singer Palak Muchhal
57.article_body: Singer Palak Muchhal who has sung songs like 'Laapata' from 'Ek Tha Tiger' said she has saved 2,305 lives through her concerts which help raise money for heart, kidney patients. "There are still 436 kids in my list waiting to get operated," she added. "Every time I sing a life is saved..., what can be a bigger blessing," stated Palak.

58.title: Info Edge acquires 76% stake in B'luru dating app Aisle for ₹91 cr
58.article_body: Info Edge has announced that it has acquired a 76% stake in dating platform ﻿Aisle﻿ for ₹91 crore. One of early Zomato backers, Info Edge operates platforms like Naukri, Jeevansathi, 99acres, and Shiksha. Post the acquisition, Aisle Founder and CEO Able Joseph will continue to run the company with support from Info Edge's ecosystem.

59.title: A rogue individual is trying to harass me; it is fake news: Sonakshi on warrant
59.article_body: Actress Sonakshi Sinha has said reports claiming that a non-bailable warrant has been issued against her for not attending an event in Delhi after allegedly taking ₹37 lakh in advance are "fake". "This is pure fiction and work of a rogue individual trying to harass me," she added. "This man is trying to extort money from me," she further said.

60.title: Wasn't called on Kapil's show as 'The Kashmir...' has no big star: Vivek
60.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' director Vivek Agnihotri took to Twitter to say that he and his team were not called on 'The Kapil Sharma Show' because they do not have a commercial star. "I don't get to decide who should be invited on @KapilSharmaK9 show. It's his and his producers' choice whom he wants to invite," he said in another tweet.

61.title: After India, Pakistan lose to Australia in Women's ODI World Cup
61.article_body: Pakistan suffered their second defeat in a row in the ongoing ICC Women's ODI World Cup after losing to Australia on Tuesday. Meg Lanning-led Australia won the toss and opted to bowl, restricting Pakistan to 190/6 in 50 overs. Alyssa Healy then smashed 72 off 79 balls to help her side win the match by seven wickets in 34.4 overs.

62.title: Akshay mourns the loss of his pet dog, says 'You took a part of our hearts'
62.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar and his wife Twinkle Khanna mourned the loss of their pet dog, Cleo, whom they had for 12 years. Sharing a picture with Twinkle and Cleo, Akshay wrote, "They say dogs leave paw prints on our hearts. You took a part of our hearts with you today. Rest well up there, Cleo. Will miss you."

63.title: Do something that makes an Indian uncle go 'Why is she like this?': Richa
63.article_body: Actress Richa Chadha took to Instagram to wish everyone on the occasion of International Women's Day and stated, "Do something with your life that...makes an Indian uncle go 'Why is she like this?'." "Every day is Women's Day," added Richa in her post. "Grateful for your womb and fire of life maa," read an Instagram post from Kangana Ranaut.

64.title: Cong MLA rides horse to Jharkhand Assembly on International Women's Day
64.article_body: Congress MLA Amba Prasad on Tuesday rode a horse to Jharkhand Assembly on the occasion of International Women's Day 2022. "There is Durga, Jhansi ki Rani in every woman...Parents must educate their daughters as women are doing well in every field," she said. Amba also rode a horse to the state Assembly last year on International Women's Day.

65.title: UK PM refuses to ease visa requirements for Ukrainians fleeing war
65.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson has rejected calls for the UK to ease visa requirements for Ukrainian refugees fleeing the war. "We're a...very generous country," but we want to maintain checks on who is arriving in Britain, Johnson added. The British government has been criticised for requiring refugees to first acquire a visa, leaving some Ukrainians stranded in France's Calais city.

66.title: RBI launches UPI for feature phones; transactions won't require internet
66.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das has launched a UPI-based payment product for feature phones called UPI123Pay. The product will allow customers to use feature phones for almost all transactions, except scan and pay, and it doesn't need internet connection for transactions. This will help NPCI reach its goal of processing a billion transactions a day, the RBI said.

67.title: Zoe Kravitz recalls losing 'Dark Knight Rises' audition due to skin colour
67.article_body: Actress Zoe Kravitz said that she wanted to audition for a role in Christopher Nolan's film 'The Dark Knight Rises' but was rejected because she was "urban". "Being a woman of colour...being an actor and being told...that I wasn't able to read because of the colour of my skin...and word 'urban' being thrown around...that was really hard," she added.

68.title: Guj man sentenced to death for raping, murdering minor & killing her mother
68.article_body: Surat court on Monday convicted a man of raping and murdering an 11-year-old girl and killing her mother. While he was sentenced to death, his aide was given life sentence till natural death. Police had discovered her body with injury marks in bushes at Sai-fakir garden in Surat on April 6, 2018. Her mother's body was discovered three days later.

69.title: It was fire: Big B as writer Vivek Ranjit praises Abhishek's acting in Sarkar
69.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan reacted after writer Vivek Ranjit praised actor Abhishek Bachchan's performance in the film 'Sarkar'. Vivek Ranjit tweeted a picture of Abhishek from 'Sarkar' and wrote, "Abhishek in #Sarkar is my fav...in that last scene, [he] was pure [fire]...So calm yet fierce." Reacting to it, Amitabh wrote, "I shall absolutely agree with that...it was pure [fire]."

70.title: Woman mistreating aged in-laws has no right to live in their house: Delhi HC
70.article_body: The Delhi High Court has ruled that a woman has no right to live in her in-law's house if she mistreats them. A daughter-in-law can be evicted from the aged in-laws' house as they have the right to live peacefully, the court added. The court's verdict came after a woman approached High Court asking right to accommodation in matrimonial house.

71.title: Body of 21-year-old Indian student to be brought back after shelling stops in Ukraine
71.article_body: Minister of External Affairs S Jaishankar has informed Karnataka government that the body of 21-year-old Naveen Shekharappa, who was killed in shelling in Ukraine amid Russian military operations, will be brought to India once shelling stops, said Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai. Bommai added that Naveen's body was embalmed and kept in a mortuary in Ukraine.

72.title: How has Ukraine been able to stop far superior Russian army from advancing?
72.article_body: Experts have said Ukraine has been able to stop far superior Russian army from advancing because of a combination of good preparation, national solidarity and Russian mistakes. Experts added that Russia underestimated Ukrainian forces' home-turf advantage, including knowledge of terrain. Russia also failed to get ground and air forces to work alongside each other, they further said.

73.title: Pak captain Bismah's cradle celebration for daughter after fifty in Women's WC goes viral
73.article_body: Pakistan captain Bismah Maroof's cradle celebration for her six-month-old daughter after scoring fifty against Australia in Women's World Cup has gone viral. "Just second match into her comeback after childbirth and our captain scores a half-century and she dedicates it to her daughter, Fatima," Pakistan Cricket tweeted. Earlier, pictures and videos of Indian team playing with Fatima went viral.

74.title: Credit Suisse cuts India's rating to 'underweight', cites rising crude prices
74.article_body: Credit Suisse has downgraded India's rating to 'underweight' from 'overweight' in the wake of rising crude oil prices, referring to the cut as "tactical". In Asia, India is the "most vulnerable to higher oil prices, along with the Philippines", the agency noted. The downgrade comes as crude oil prices briefly hit a 14-year high on Monday amid the Russia-Ukraine war.

75.title: Over 17,400 Indians evacuated from Ukraine under Op Ganga: Govt
75.article_body: India has brought back over 17,400 citizens from war-torn Ukraine under Operation Ganga so far, the Ministry of Civil Aviation said. Two special civilian flights scheduled from Suceava are expected to bring 400 more Indians back home on March 8, the ministry added. The Government of India started evacuating Indians from Ukraine through special flights on February 22.

76.title: Guardiola and I have pushed each other to insane levels: Liverpool coach Klopp
76.article_body: With Manchester City six points ahead of them at the top of the Premier League standings, Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp said the competition between the two teams is pushing them both to greatness. "City manager Pep Guardiola and I have pushed each other to insane levels in the last few years," Klopp stated. Liverpool have 63 points from 27 games.

77.title: Lashkar-e-Taiba associate held by security forces in J&K's Baramulla
77.article_body: Security forces on Monday arrested a Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) associate in Baramulla district of Jammu and Kashmir. In a joint operation, the Sopore Police along with 32 Rashtriya Rifles and 92 Battalion CRPF launched a cordon and search operation in the Rafiabad subdivision. Police also seized one AK 56 along with magazine and 30 live rounds from his possession.

78.title: Selling agarbattis to successful salon expert, meet Mita: Urban Company
78.article_body: Urban Company recently captured the inspiring story of Kolkata-based Mita in an episode of UC Impact. A single mother, Mita built her life from selling agarbattis to becoming a successful salon professional today. In the episode, she has shared how she is empowering her daughter, who is studying English Honours, undergoing air hostess training, and plans to pursue LLB.

79.title: Russian oil ban will be catastrophic, prices could hit $300 a barrel: Deputy PM
79.article_body: Russian Deputy Prime Minister Alexander Novak has warned that a ban on Russian oil imports by Western countries "would lead to catastrophic consequences for the global market". "The surge in prices would be unpredictable. It would be $300 per barrel if not more," he added. On Monday, Brent crude price briefly hit $139/barrel for the first time since July 2008.

80.title: Which are now world's 5 most-sanctioned countries as Russia tops list?
80.article_body: According to Castellum.AI, a global sanctions-tracking database, Russia has become the world's most-sanctioned country, with a total of 5,532 sanctions designations. It's followed by Iran, which has faced 3,616 sanctions over a decade, and Syria with 2,608 sanctions. North Korea stands fourth with 2,077 sanctions, while Venezuela stands fifth with 651 sanctions.

81.title: What are the major announcements made in Haryana Budget 2022-23?
81.article_body: In his Budget 2022-23 speech, Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday proposed a budget of over ₹1.77 lakh crore. Families whose annual income is ₹1.80 lakh or below will be provided with a free basic health checkup facility once in two years, he said. Khattar announced a school health programme to screen 25 lakh school children twice a year.

82.title: Coinbase blocks 25,000 Russia-linked addresses over illicit activity
82.article_body: Cryptocurrency trading platform Coinbase has blocked over 25,000 wallet addresses related to Russian individuals or entities that it believes to be engaging in illicit activity. The company has shared these addresses with the US government to "support sanctions enforcement". The move comes just days after Coinbase CEO said the firm had no preemptive plans to ban Russian users.

83.title: Women police to head all police stations in TN's Avadi on Women's Day
83.article_body: All police stations under Tamil Nadu's Avadi Commissionerate will be headed by an all-women force on Tuesday to mark International Women's Day. "For the first time in India, all police stations in a Commissionerate will be headed by women. This initiative is to recognise, honour, celebrate and cherish the role of women in our uniformed services," a senior officer said.

84.title: Women are capable of transforming society by their strength: Rahul Gandhi
84.article_body: On the occasion of International Women's Day, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said that women are capable of transforming society by their wisdom, dedication and strength. "They must get their long-pending due. Women's Day greetings to all," Gandhi tweeted. Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi will take out an all-female march in Lucknow on the occasion.

85.title: Women are no longer just pretty faces or avenging angels: Madhuri
85.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit said there has been a "tremendous" evolution in the roles written for women, with women no longer viewed as "just pretty faces" or "avenging angels". "Women are viewed as whole people. It is fascinating to see this change," added Madhuri. "We aren't just a part of the story but we are the story," stated actress Neena Gupta.

86.title: Women rooting for each other, that’s true empowerment: Rakul Preet
86.article_body: Talking about women empowerment on the occasion of International Women's Day, actress Rakul Preet Singh said women rooting for each other is "true empowerment" in her opinion. "Women's empowerment...is when all women in some way...support and are genuinely happy with each other's accomplishments," added Rakul Preet. "When a female actor does well, it...pushes me to do...better," she stated.

87.title: Prabhas sent food to every 'Radhe...' team member down with COVID: Pooja
87.article_body: Terming actor Prabhas as very humble despite having a "huge" fanbase, actress Pooja Hegde said Prabhas sent food to every member of their film 'Radhe Shyam' who had tested positive for COVID-19. "My mother also felt happy about this lovely gesture," she added. "Jr NTR is...a perfectionist. His shots get [approved] in a single take," stated Pooja.

88.title: Muslim men allege assault in Gurugram's Sector 45, 2 booked
88.article_body: Two persons have been booked for allegedly assaulting two Muslim men outside a Sector 45 hotel in Gurugram, the police said. The victims were identified as Mohammad Azam, a madrassa teacher and Abdur Rahman, a construction worker. The victims claimed that the suspects assaulted and robbed them of their motorcycle and two mobile phones and fed Azam a "weird" powder.

89.title: Alexander Zverev placed on one-year probation for outburst against umpire
89.article_body: World number three Alexander Zverev has been put on probation for a year for smashing his racquet against the umpire's chair in Mexican Open last month. During the probation period, if Zverev receives a code violation that results in a fine for unsportsmanlike conduct, he'll be suspended from ATP events for eight weeks and fined $25,000.

90.title: Test cricket will stop if we don't play Kohli, Rohit: Aakash Chopra
90.article_body: Ex-India opener Aakash Chopra said Test cricket will stop if Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma and Jasprit Bumrah do not play in matches, adding that it will "die" being already on the "ventilator". "There is no contest, there is no context, the matches get over in three days," stated Aakash. Team India's Mohali Test against Sri Lanka ended in three days.

91.title: Apple suspends advertising on App Store in Russia
91.article_body: Apple has suspended advertising on its App Store in Russia, barring developers from placing ads in search results. "No new campaigns will be eligible to run on the App Store in Russia for the duration of the suspension," Apple said in an email sent to developers. The decision comes days after the company halted product sales in Russia.

92.title: Success goes to one's head but with Big B it's different: Jhund director
92.article_body: Director Nagraj Manjule spoke about his experience of working with Amitabh Bachchan in 'Jhund'. He said, "I never knew...one day I'd make a film with Bachchan sir." "Despite having done...many movies, he continues to show extreme dedication and passion for the craft. As they say, success goes to one's head, but with Amitabh sir it is different," he added

93.title: Google may buy US firm Mandiant after Microsoft drops out: Report
93.article_body: Google is in talks to buy cybersecurity firm Mandiant, in what would be its second-biggest deal ever, after Microsoft backed out of discussions, Bloomberg reported. Microsoft pulled out of talks more than a week ago on concerns that Mandiant's businesses weren't a good enough strategic fit. The shares of Mandiant rose 16% at the close of trading on Monday.

94.title: Vaishno Devi Shrine Board files FIR against fake chopper booking sites
94.article_body: Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Shrine Board has filed an FIR with the Jammu and Kashmir Police’s cyber department against fake websites for cheating devotees on the pretext of providing tickets for chopper bookings. "Bookings can be made only on our official website or on phone application, nowhere else," Ramesh Kumar, Shrine Board CEO, said.

95.title: 2 college students in Pune robbed at knifepoint by auto driver, aides
95.article_body: An auto-rickshaw driver and his aides allegedly robbed two college students at knifepoint in Pune on Sunday. The students had taken an auto to go to the private bus stand in Sangamwadi, but the driver took them to a public road near the railway gauge in Mangalwar Peth. The duo was then robbed of ₹1000 cash and ₹3,800 via PhonePe.

96.title: Rejected by Indian Army twice over height, 21-year-old student to fight for Ukraine
96.article_body: Tamil Nadu's Sainikhesh Ravichandran, a 21-year-old aerospace engineering student at National Aerospace University in Ukraine's Kharkiv, has taken up arms to fight for Ukraine against Russia. Sainikhesh, who was rejected by Indian Army twice due to his height, has reportedly joined the Georgian National Legion Paramilitary unit. His family said they had asked him to return but he refused.

97.title: CSK sign Ireland's Josh Little as net bowler for IPL 2022
97.article_body: Ireland pacer Josh Little has been roped in as a net bowler by CSK for the upcoming season of IPL. The 22-year-old has played 19 ODIs and 34 T20Is, picking 30 and 31 wickets respectively in the two formats. "Congrats to Josh, who is heading off on a development opportunity with the CSK...experience should be fantastic," said Cricket Ireland.

98.title: Go SpaceX: Kimbal on Russia's 'let US fly to space on broomsticks' remark
98.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk's brother Kimbal Musk cheered SpaceX on Twitter saying, "Go SpaceX", recting to Russia's "let US fly to space on broomsticks" remark. "I think the United States will be just fine," he added. Earlier, Elon Musk commented on a video of SpaceX launching 47 Starlink satellites into orbit, and said, "American broomstick."

99.title: Alia Bhatt to make her Hollywood debut with 'Heart of Stone'
99.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt took to Instagram to confirm that she will make her Hollywood debut with Netflix's international spy thriller 'Heart of Stone'. The movie will also feature 'Wonder Woman' actress Gal Gadot and '50 Shades of Grey' actor Jamie Dornan. The film will be directed by British filmmaker Tom Harper. "Mini Meryl's at it again," Arjun Kapoor commented.

100.title: Ukraine's Air Force shoots down 2 Russian aircraft over Kyiv in quick succession
100.article_body: Ukraine's Air Force has shot down two Russian aircraft over Kyiv in quick succession, The Kyiv Independent said. According to Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine Valerіy Zaluzhny, Air Force hit the first plane of the Russian Federation over Kyiv at 8:30 pm. Another Russian plane was destroyed in the air battle on the city's outskirts at 9:10 pm.

101.title: Statistics of my son having autism are pretty strong: Comedian Amy Schumer
101.article_body: Comedian Amy Schumer said that the statistics of her son having autism are "pretty strong". "He's two and a half and I think they don't diagnose children until maybe six at earliest I think. You can see some signs but diagnosis doesn't come until later...I don't have a preference...You just want your kids to be healthy and happy," she added.

102.title: Pink chowki set up to help sex workers in Delhi's Shraddhanand Marg
102.article_body: Delhi Police have set up a pink police chowki at Shraddhanand Marg to empower the sex workers. "We want to help the sex workers to change profession...for that..we have decided to provide different profession courses," Kiran Sethi from GB Road's pink chowki said. "Our purpose is to provide vocational skills to women to make them employable," DCP Shweta Chauhan said.

103.title: 9 yrs ago, I defended Ukrainians' data from Russia & lost my firm: Telegram Founder
103.article_body: Russia-born Telegram Founder Pavel Durov revealed that nine years ago, when he was Russian social media giant VK's CEO, he defended private data of Ukrainians from the Russian government. "I lost my company and my home. I'd do it again without hesitation," he said amid concerns Telegram could face pressure from Russia. Users' "right to privacy is sacred", he added.

104.title: Man records over 500 naked gym members using camera hidden in coffee cup in US
104.article_body: A US man allegedly used a camera hidden in a coffee cup to film more than 500 people inside gym changing rooms. Peng Dong, 33, was arrested when a member of the Wisconsin Athletic Club found the camera. Dong told investigators that "he was only setting up his video camera to catch the person he believed was stealing his belongings".

105.title: Congress to send observers to states where assembly elections were held
105.article_body: The Congress party said on Monday that it will send observers to all the five states where assembly elections were held. This includes Punjab in-charge Harish Chaudhary and Ajay Maken, who will go to Punjab, while senior leader P Chidambaram and Karnataka Congress unit chief DK Shivakumar will head to Goa. The observers are expected to reach on Tuesday.

106.title: Morari Bapu donates ₹1.25 crore for people in Ukraine
106.article_body: Morari Bapu has taken the initiative of donating ₹1.25 crore as a means to extend help to people affected in Ukraine. Earlier, Morari Bapu's trust raised ₹19 crore for construction of Ayodhya's Ram Mandir, out of which ₹9 crore was donated by foreigners. The trust has now decided to donate ₹1.25 crore from this amount to help people in Ukraine.

107.title: Another aircraft had come in front of my plane, pilot averted head-on collision: Mamata
107.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that another aircraft had come in front of her chartered plane and it was the prompt action of the pilot that averted a head-on collision. "If the situation had continued for 10 more seconds, there would have been a head-on collision," she added. This comes two days after Mamata's chartered flight experienced mid-air turbulence.

108.title: Wait till March 10: Punjab CM Channi on exit poll predictions
108.article_body: With the exit polls predicting a win for AAP in Punjab, CM and Congress leader Charanjit Singh Channi urged the people to wait till March 10, the day when Assembly poll results will be declared. "Only boxes (EVMs) will tell what has to happen. All of you, please wait till March 10," Channi added.

109.title: CCTV footage helps independent candidate reclaim victory in TN civic polls
109.article_body: After a tie with DMK's K Subbulakshmi in Tamil Nadu urban civic polls, independent candidate R Palaniselvi questioned the draw of lots done by the Returning Officer in which Subbulakshmi was declared the winner. Palaniselvi moved the Madras High Court against the Returning Officer. On examining the CCTV footage of the counting process, the bench found Palaniselvi as the winner.

110.title: My mother-in-law dated a man 19 yrs younger than her: Rahul Mahajan
110.article_body: In a recent episode of 'Smart Jodi', contestant Rahul Mahajan said he got married secretly because he never wanted his marriage with his wife Natalya Ilina to end like his previous marriages. After a few pictures from his wedding were shown on the show, Rahul also revealed that his mother-in-law dated a guy who was 19 years younger than her.

111.title: Family said 'you are shy, don't even talk, how will you act': Actress Raashii
111.article_body: Talking about her family's reaction to her taking up acting, 'Rudra...' actress Raashii Khanna said that their first reaction was "you are so shy, you don't even talk, how will you act?" "When the trailer of Rudra came, my mother was...shocked...That's...validation I look for. My parents and my brother never gloss it up...and are my best support," she added.

112.title: Indian student in Ukraine sends pet dog to home in Rohtak with friend
112.article_body: A medical student from India, Sahil, studying in Ukraine, has reportedly sent his pet dog to his home in Rohtak before himself. Sahil sent the dog to India with his friend. He reportedly said that he would only come back to India if his pet dog comes along too. Reports said that the dog is sad without Sahil.

113.title: State govt made several efforts to contain Maoist incidents: Chhattisgarh Guv
113.article_body: Chhattisgarh Governor Anusuiya Uikey said the state government has made several efforts to contain Maoist incidents due to which development activities are reaching every part of the state. "State government's several efforts helped in effectively checking Maoist incidents. On the other hand, success has been achieved in neutralising 46 Maoists and motivating 555 ultras to surrender," Uikey added.

114.title: 5, including 8-month-old boy, charred to death in house fire in Kerala
114.article_body: Five members of a family, including an eight-month-old boy, were charred to death on Tuesday when their house caught fire in Kerala. Police said that neighbours alerted them. Attempts were made to douse the fire. However, it could not be controlled. Bikes parked at the compound of the house were also gutted in the fire.

115.title: Assam approves replacing paper ballots with EVMs in Guwahati civic polls
115.article_body: Assam Cabinet approved Guwahati Municipal Corporation (Amendment) Bill, 2022 for replacing paper ballots with EVMs in Guwahati civic polls. The decision was taken to "ensure transparency and efficiency in elections", CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said. "We took several important decisions pertaining to repealing of obsolete laws, revision of land premium rates...raising loan from NABARD," he tweeted.

116.title: Never easy for a woman to thrive in a world full of judgements: Sushmita
116.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen took to Instagram on the occasion of International Women's Day and stated that it can "never be easy" for a woman to thrive in a world full of judgements. "To teach it mercy, ah," added Sushmita in the post. "Whatever be the journey, it is beautiful to be a woman," the actress stated.

117.title: Require more women in force to tackle protests: K'taka DG
117.article_body: Karnataka DG and IGP Praveen Sood said the state police needs more women in its reserve forces. "We have witnessed...that women are at the forefront of protests in the state. During the hijab controversy, most of the protesters were women," Sood told Hindustan Times. He added, a new women battalion recently announced in the state budget will help ease workload.

118.title: Russia becomes world's most-sanctioned country
118.article_body: Russia has overtaken Iran to become the world's most-sanctioned country, days after its invasion of Ukraine. Since February 22, Russia has been the target of 2,778 new sanctions designations led by the US and European allies, bringing its total to 5,532, as per global database firm Castellum.AI. Iran has confronted 3,616 sanctions against it over the course of a decade.

119.title: Indian among foreigners to fight for Ukraine against Russia, pic surfaces
119.article_body: Ukraine's Ministry of Foreign Affairs took to Facebook to share a picture of some of the foreigners who have volunteered to fight for Ukraine against Russia. "International Legion of Defence of Ukraine is here! A group of volunteers from USA, UK, Sweden, Lithuania, Mexico and India in Kyiv," the ministry wrote.

120.title: Ranbir looks at my childhood pics and says, 'God, you're an alien': Alia
120.article_body: Speaking about her father Mahesh Bhatt calling her a "mystery", actress Alia Bhatt said, "Ranbir says that to me all the time. And this is the first time I've heard my father say it to me." "Even when Ranbir looks at my childhood photos, he says, 'Look at your eyes. God, you're an alien. What are these eyes?'," Alia said.

121.title: 114 held in illegal arms cases in Gujarat Police's special drive in Feb
121.article_body: As many as 106 cases were lodged and 114 persons were arrested for illegal sale, smuggling, purchase, possession and production of firearms and ammunition across Gujarat in a special drive by Gujarat Police in February. The month-long drive, from February 1 to February 28, was conducted across all 33 districts of Gujarat.

122.title: Top Russian Army general killed in Ukraine
122.article_body: A top Russian Army general has been killed in fighting around Kharkiv, Ukrainian intelligence has claimed. Major General Vitaly Gerasimov, chief of staff of the 41st Army, was killed along with other senior officers. Investigative journalism agency Bellingcat said it had confirmed Gerasimov's death with a Russian source.

123.title: Zelenskyy reveals his location on Instagram, says 'I'm not hiding, not afraid of anyone'
123.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday revealed his location in Kyiv on Instagram. He put out a video from his office on Bankova Street in Kyiv, saying, "I'm not hiding. And I'm not afraid of anyone." He added, "You know we used to say, Monday is a hard day. There is war in the country, so every day is Monday."

124.title: BJP will win more seats in final results than predicted in exit polls: U'khand CM
124.article_body: Soon after the exit polls predicted an edge to BJP in the state Assembly polls, Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said the party would win more seats in the final results than predicted in the exit polls. "People of Uttarakhand have shown faith in us and will form the government," Dhami added.

125.title: Czech President to award state honour to Ukraine’s Prez Zelenskyy
125.article_body: Czech Republic President Milos Zeman on Monday announced that he would award the highest state honours to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. "This is because the Ukrainian President has shown courage and bravery, and although the United States offered him an evacuation, he stayed in the capital of his country, from where he is leading its defence," Zeman said.

126.title: Russia will not send conscript soldiers to fight in Ukraine: Putin
126.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin said that he will not send conscript soldiers to fight in Ukraine. "And there will be no additional call-up of reservists," he added in a televised address. "The fixed objectives are only carried out by professional servicemen. I'm sure they are guaranteeing security and peace for the Russian people in an effective manner," Putin further said.

127.title: Avalanche hits Himachal Pradesh's Rohli, roads blocked
127.article_body: An avalanche has hit Rohli (10 km ahead from Tindi towards Killar) in Lahaul and Spiti district of Himachal Pradesh, blocking roads, the State Emergency Operation Centre informed in an official statement. Around five-six vehicles are stuck between Rohli and Kadu Nallah and a police rescue team has already rushed to the spot to help people, the statement further added.

128.title: 28-year-old bodyguard shoots himself dead in Gurugram's Sector 83
128.article_body: A 28-year-old bodyguard, who worked as a personal security officer for clients of a private security agency, allegedly shot himself dead in Gurugram's Sector 83, police said. The victim's body was recovered from a forest area near his house, police added. "Preliminary investigation revealed, he wanted to be in a relationship with a woman...but it didn't work out," police stated.

129.title: Kerala Police seize drugs worth ₹1.5 cr, couple arrested
129.article_body: Kerala Police arrested a couple and seized 1.95 kg of MDMA worth ₹1.5 crore on Monday. According to police, the contraband was wrapped in a cloth and brought from Bengaluru in a bus. The couple, hailing from Muzhappilangad, was arrested from Kannur Plaza junction. Police also seized 67 grams of brown sugar and 7.5 grams of opium from the couple.

130.title: Alia is most talented, want her to play me in my biopic: Barkha Dutt
130.article_body: Journalist Barkha Dutt said that she wants actress Alia Bhatt to play her in her biopic. "I am not saying this because she just has a film out but I am saying this because I really think most talented actor is Alia Bhatt. I mean there's no question...range, the sheer range, the ease with which she plays everything," she added.

131.title: West Indies Tests are opportunity for us to prove a point: Joe Root
131.article_body: England Test captain Joe Root has said the three-Test series against West Indies is an opportunity for them to prove a point after their 0-4 defeat in the Ashes. "We know historically it's not an easy place for England to come and play...so it's something that we're very much looking forward to. It's a big challenge for us," Root stated.

132.title: Delhi's bus fleet crosses 7,000-mark for the first time
132.article_body: The national capital's bus fleet crossed 7,000-mark for the first time on Monday after Delhi's Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot inducted 100 new CNG buses and one electric bus into the city's bus fleet. Gahlot said over 30 lakh people used a public bus every day in February which is the highest daily ridership for Delhi's bus services since pandemic started.

133.title: Why should I hold 2nd position? My time has passed: Kapil Dev as Ashwin breaks his record
133.article_body: After Ravichandran Ashwin overtook him to become India's second-highest wicket-taker in Tests, Kapil Dev said, "It’s a great achievement especially from a guy who didn't get enough opportunities in...recent past." He added, "Had Ashwin got those opportunities...he would've crossed 434 much earlier. I'm happy for him...why should I hold [the second position] from him? My time has passed."

134.title: Ukraine suffers ₹77,000 crore in damage to infrastructure since Russian invasion
134.article_body: Ukraine has suffered about $10 billion (₹77,000 crore) in damage to infrastructure since Russia invaded the country, Infrastructure Minister Oleksander Kubrakov said on Monday. "The majority of damaged structures will be repaired in a year, and the most difficult ones – in two years," he added. Kubrakov further said that Russia is doing "all it can to prevent humanitarian corridors".

135.title: Last picture taken of Shane Warne shared by his friend
135.article_body: Shane Warne's friend Thomas Hall has shared the last photo taken of the late Australian cricket legend. The photo was taken at Thailand's Koh Samui, where Warne was holidaying. "Anybody that knew Shane knew his warmth, caring, his incredible sense of humour...his laugh...twinkle in his eye and that glare from those glowing, unnaturally white teeth," Hall wrote while paying tribute.

136.title: Warren Buffett among world's 5 richest people again as fortune hits $117 billion
136.article_body: Berkshire Hathaway CEO Warren Buffett's net worth has grown by over 7% this year to around $117 billion as his company's shares rallied, Bloomberg reported. The 91-year-old is now back among the world's five richest people, after falling to as low as world's 11th richest person in October. World's richest person Elon Musk's wealth has dropped by 15% this year.

137.title: Shane Warne's daughter shares pics & videos with him, says 'This can't be real life'
137.article_body: Late Australian cricketer Shane Warne's daughter Summer took to Instagram to share pictures and videos with him. She wrote, "It feels like I'm dreaming...waiting for someone to wake me up and tell me...you're okay. This can't be real life." She added, "I took our time for granted dad...I'd do anything to have more time with you on this earth."

138.title: AAP going to be national, natural replacement of Congress: Raghav Chadha
138.article_body: Following exit polls predicting AAP's majority in Punjab Assembly polls, party leader Raghav Chadha said that the party is going to be the national and natural replacement of Congress. "Exit poll results tell us that the people of Punjab have overwhelmingly voted for change...AAP is now the fastest-growing political party," Chadha said.

139.title: Harry Kane scores twice as Tottenham defeat Everton 5-0 in EPL
139.article_body: Harry Kane scored twice as Tottenham Hotspur handed Everton their third straight defeat in the Premier League. Notably, Kane's brace in their 5-0 win has moved him above Arsenal legend Thierry Henry for a sixth place on the all-time Premier League top scorers' list with 176 goals. Tottenham are placed seventh on the points table with 45 points.

140.title: KCR doesn't respect Constitution of India, wants to write his own: BJP MLA
140.article_body: BJP MLA Raghunandan Rao said Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao wants to write his own Constitution of India as the leader does not want to respect the Indian Constitution. His remark came after he and other BJP MLAs Raja Singh and Eatala Rajender were suspended from the Budget session in the Telangana Assembly.

141.title: Won't restrain BJP MLA Vijender Gupta in defamation case: Delhi HC
141.article_body: Delhi High Court on Monday refused to restrain BJP MLA Vijender Gupta from posting defamatory content on social media against Delhi Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot. "None should be prevented from expressing their opinions...on the government's transaction of business," HC added. The case pertains to the alleged irregularities in the purchase and maintenance of 1,000 low-floor DTC buses.

142.title: India reports 3,993 new COVID-19 cases, 108 deaths in last 24 hours
142.article_body: India has reported 3,993 new COVID-19 cases and 108 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Out of the 108 deaths, 49 deaths occurred during the day in the country while 59 were reconciled deaths in Kerala. India's COVID-19 death toll reached 5,15,210, and the active cases declined to 49,948.

143.title: 3 youths drown while swimming in reservoir in Pune's Daund
143.article_body: Three youths, aged 20-21, drowned in a water reservoir in Pune's Daund on Sunday, police said. "The probe so far has indicated that the three entered the water reservoir for swimming. But they got drowned," Inspector Vinod Ghuge of Daund Police Station said. The police have recovered the three bodies, and they have been sent to a hospital for post-mortem.

144.title: Free tabs only for students of classes 10-12 for now, clears Haryana govt
144.article_body: Haryana's Education Minister Kanwar Pal said the government will distribute free tablets only to students of classes 10-12 for now. Though they earlier promised to include class 8 and 9 students in the scheme, he said they would be considered later. Pal also said that tenders for tablets worth ₹620 crore have already been issued by the government.

145.title: ₹3,866 cr set aside to treat sewage in Hyd in T'gana Budget 2022-23
145.article_body: Telangana Finance Minister Harish Rao Thanneeru on Monday presented the state Budget 2022-23. Of the total ₹2,56,958 crore proposed expenditure, ₹3,866 crore will be used to treat sewage in Hyderabad. ₹1,542 crore will be spent towards the maintenance of roads in Hyderabad, Rao added. The government has set aside ₹725 crore for 'Sunkishala' drinking water project, he stated.

146.title: Troll says even Abhishek can't believe when he's offered a film, actor reacts
146.article_body: Abhishek Bachchan replied to a Twitter user who tried to troll him. The user shared a meme and took a veiled dig on the actor's career, it read, "When Abhishek gets...call from any director for a movie. You're not making a fool of me right?" Abhishek wrote with sarcasm, "Hey man! Loved your bio. 'Whatever you are...Be a good one'."

147.title: Man locks, kills wife in bathroom of rented house in Pune, booked
147.article_body: Pune Police have booked a man, Sham Dhere, for locking his wife, Ritu Dhere, in the bathroom of their house and killing her in Akurdi on Sunday. Police said that the couple was living in a rented room. Police added that woman's body was found in bathroom that had been locked from outside. Case under Section 302 has been registered.

148.title: Russia declares ceasefire in 5 Ukraine cities including Kyiv for evacuation of civilians
148.article_body: Russia on Tuesday declared a ceasefire amid the ongoing war in Ukraine from 10 am Moscow time (12.30 pm IST) to provide humanitarian corridors for the evacuation of civilians in the cities of Kyiv, Chernihiv, Sumy, Kharkiv and Mariupol, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Russia said. The development comes following the third round of talks between Russia and Ukraine.

149.title: Participation of citizens must to improve air quality: Environment Minister
149.article_body: Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav stressed the importance of citizens' participation in improving air quality. "Dust management, solid waste management, open waste burning, industrial and vehicular pollution are...key factors that need to be addressed for improving air quality," he said during 'Interactive Dialogue Towards Clean Air' organised by Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM).

150.title: Fire breaks out at fireworks factory in Tamil Nadu, 1 dead
150.article_body: A fire broke out at a fireworks manufacturing unit in Virudhunagar district of Tamil Nadu on Monday. According to the district administration, one person died while another suffered burn injuries in the incident. Earlier, in January this year, four people were killed in a similar fire accident in a firecracker unit in the district.

151.title: MMB floats tender for new jetty, terminal facilities at Mumbai's Radio club
151.article_body: In a move to decongest the existing jetties at the Gateway of India, the Maharashtra Maritime Board floated a tender for the construction of a passenger jetty and terminal facilities at Mumbai's Radio club in Colaba. It is expected to cost ₹80 crore to be completed and the Central and state government will have an equal share in the expenditure.

152.title: Bengaluru sees less than 100 COVID-19 cases; positivity rate at 0.86%
152.article_body: Bengaluru on Monday reported 97 new COVID-19 cases as compared to 146 new cases reported on Sunday, according to Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) data. The city also reported three coronavirus-related deaths in the last 24 hours. The daily COVID-19 positivity rate in Bengaluru dropped to 0.86% as compared to 0.9% reported on Sunday, the data showed.

153.title: Would he want break from IPL? BCB President on Shakib's request for break
153.article_body: After Bangladesh all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan requested pulling out of their upcoming tour of South Africa, stating that he can't play so much international cricket, BCB President Nazmul Hasan questioned Shakib's commitment to the national side. "Would he have said the same thing if he was picked in the IPL?" asked Nazmul. "It's surprising, to be honest," he added.

154.title: Ukrainian soldier proposes to his girlfriend at checkpoint amid war, video goes viral
154.article_body: A video of a Ukrainian soldier proposing to his girlfriend after stopping her at checkpoint amid war with Russia went viral. In the video, the troops can be seen questioning a group of people, who have placed their hands on a car's roof. The soldier gets down on one knee and surprises her with a ring as she turns around.

155.title: Safe corridor for our students in Ukraine's Sumy didn't materialise: India to UNSC
155.article_body: Addressing the UNSC on the humanitarian situation in Ukraine, India's UN Ambassador TS Tirumurti reiterated the urgent demand for the safe and uninterrupted passage for all civilians, including Indians stranded in Ukraine. He said India is deeply concerned that despite its repeated urgings to both Russia and Ukraine, the safe corridor for students stranded in Sumy did not materialise.

156.title: Better.com, that fired 900 staff on Zoom, plans laying off 4,000 this week: Report
156.article_body: Three months after Better.com's CEO Vishal Garg fired 900 workers on a Zoom call, the US-based mortgage company is planning to lay off around 4,000 people this week, TechCrunch reported citing sources. That is about 50% of its staff of about 8,000. Following the December layoffs, Garg apologised, saying that he "blundered the execution" and took time off.

157.title: Man tries to sodomise 8-yr-old boy in Guj, drowns him in river; held
157.article_body: A man has been arrested for forcibly drowning an eight-year-old boy in Gujarat. "He abducted the victim after luring him with promises of buying a...toy...accused then took the child to banks of Mahisagar river...tried to sodomise him...the child started crying...the accused...forcibly drowned him in the Mahisagar river," police said. Police added that the boy had gone missing on March 2.

158.title: Indian Embassy praises its driver for injured student's 700 km transit in Ukraine
158.article_body: The Indian Embassy in Ukraine has tweeted, "Kudos to Indian Embassy driver who successfully transferred Harjot over 700km from Kyiv to Bodomierz border under dangers of shelling and constraints of fuel shortage, road blocks, detours and traffic jams." Harjot, who sustained bullet injuries in Kyiv, was taken by road so that he can board an evacuation flight to return home.

159.title: Initially people used to say I don't look like a heroine: Madhuri
159.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit spoke about the time when people used to question if she can become a successful actor. Madhuri said, "People used to say that I don't look like a heroine because I was a very young girl from the Maharashtrian root, very petite." "My mother...[used to say] you do good work and you will get recognition," she added.

160.title: 5 held in Pune for kidnapping, threatening to kill youth over loan money
160.article_body: Pune Police arrested five people within four hours after they allegedly kidnapped youth from a petrol pump on Pune-Solapur highway. Police found victim had borrowed ₹20,000 from an accused and had returned ₹15,000. However, accused allegedly demanded ₹1 lakh more, which led to dispute. Accused then kidnapped victim and threatened to kill him if he did not pay ₹1 lakh.

161.title: Sisodia inaugurates health clinics in 20 Delhi government schools
161.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM and Education Minister Manish Sisodia on Monday inaugurated health clinics called Aam Aadmi School Clinics (AASC) in 20 government schools across the national capital. "An extension of the mohalla clinics...AASC will have a psychologist along with the doctor to examine and look over the mental and physical well-being of the students," Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain tweeted.

162.title: Gurugram civic body worker beats salon staff over wife's makeup, suspended
162.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) has suspended a junior engineer for allegedly beating, abusing and threatening the staff of a salon in sector 38 on Friday. The man reportedly created ruckus at the salon after his wife expressed disappointment over the makeup done by the staff. Police said the man also left the salon without paying ₹5,000 for service.

163.title: Wanted top Maoist leader Kanchan Da, his aide arrested from Assam
163.article_body: Police have arrested the most wanted and top Maoist leader Kanchan Da and his aide from Assam's Cachar district. The 72-year-old leader was arrested along with Akash Orang from the Patimara tea garden based on information the police had received, ANI reported. A laptop, mobile phone, other devices, Maoist literature and ₹3.60 lakh were recovered from them.

164.title: 4-laning of Mumbai-Goa highway to be completed by May 2023
164.article_body: Four-laning of the Mumbai-Goa highway will be completed by May 2023, said Maharashtra PWD Minister Ashok Chavan. "Over 67% of the widening work on the 11 packages have been completed. However, work on four portions between Indapur-Vadpale, Parshuram Ghat-Adavali, Adavali-Sangameshwar and Sangameshwar-Lanja is stuck," Chavan said. Work on the 471-kilometre-long project had started in 2011.

165.title: SC directs 6 banks to release ₹1,200 cr for stalled Amrapali projects
165.article_body: The Supreme Court has ordered six banks to release ₹1,200 crore before March 14 to aid the National Buildings Constructions Corporation (NBCC) in completing Amrapali's stalled projects. Bank of Baroda, the consortium's lead bank, told SC that it has already infused its share of ₹300 crore. NBCC said it'll also be conducting an independent structural audit of Amrapali's under-construction projects.

166.title: Surveys don't matter, SP will get a majority in UP: Akhilesh
166.article_body: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on Monday dismissed pre-poll surveys that showed an edge to the BJP in the Uttar Pradesh elections. "Let them show whatever they have got. We are winning with a majority," he said. The SP-led alliance will form the next government in Uttar Pradesh with over 300 seats, Akhilesh claimed.

167.title: TMC 'goons' tried to attack my convoy: West Bengal BJP chief
167.article_body: West Bengal BJP president Sukanta Majumdar has claimed some alleged TMC "goons" tried to attack his convoy at Mathurapur in West Bengal's South 24 Parganas district on Monday. "TMC still thinks that they can stop BJP by such attacks. I assure them they would fail in their attempts," Sukanta said. "We will not stop," he added.

168.title: Priyanka to lead Cong's all-female march in Lucknow tomorrow
168.article_body: The Congress will take out an all-female march in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow on International Women's Day on Tuesday. Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra will lead the march, party's national spokesperson Supriya Shrinate said on Sunday. All women office-bearers of the party and others will take part in it, Supriya said.

169.title: Poor, middle class benefitted from 'Jan Aushadhi Kendras': PM Modi
169.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday said the poor and middle class have benefitted from the 'Jan Aushadhi Kendras' set up to provide generic drugs at affordable prices. He also interacted with the beneficiaries and took feedback from them. "These centres are not just government stores but are becoming solution centres for the common man," PM Modi said.

170.title: Sadikali Shihab Thangal chosen as IUML's new Kerala president
170.article_body: Syed Sadikali Shihab Thangal has been chosen as the new Kerala state president of the Indian Union Muslim League (IUML). He has also been named as the chairman of the National Political Advisory Committee of the IUML. The development comes a day after former state president Hyderali Shihab Thangal passed away at the age of 74.

171.title: Free rides on buses, i-buses for Indore women on Women's Day
171.article_body: Women in Madhya Pradesh's Indore will be allowed to travel free of cost in city buses and i-buses on the occasion of International Women's Day on Tuesday. Municipal Commissioner Pratibha Pal said that "Atal Indore City Transport Services Limited is providing this gift to women for one day". Concerned officials have been instructed to provide the service to all women.

172.title: Trilogy on Shivaji Maharaj delayed due to pandemic: Nagraj
172.article_body: Filmmaker Nagraj Manjule has said his multilingual trilogy on Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj is facing delays due to the COVID-19 pandemic but has not been put on the back burner. "We lost two years...so naturally we could not take it on floors," he said. "Once everything falls into place, you will know," he added.

173.title: Filmmaker Priyadarshan felicitated with honorary doctorate: Report
173.article_body: Filmmaker Priyadarshan was reportedly conferred an honorary doctorate on Monday. He was felicitated by the Hindustan Institute of Technology and Science in Chennai. However, the filmmaker is yet to officially announce this. Priyadarshan last directed Hindi film 'Hungama 2' which premiered on an OTT platform. The film starred Shilpa Shetty and Paresh Rawal in lead roles.

174.title: Woman survives after falling from 5th floor of high-rise in Ujjain
174.article_body: A woman survived after falling from the fifth floor of a high-rise building in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain on Saturday. Sushmita Yadav had reportedly fallen on a guava tree and was rushed to hospital by some students. Yadav, who is an employee of a private company Profit-mart located in the building, is currently out of danger, according to doctors.

175.title: Women police personnel to manage traffic in MP on Women's Day
