175.article_body: Women police personnel will be handling traffic management across Madhya Pradesh along with their male counterparts on the occasion of International Women's Day on Tuesday. The initiative is aimed at boosting confidence and self-esteem of women and to convey the message that they can work shoulder-to-shoulder with men, state Home Minister Dr Narottam Mishra said.

176.title: Will be clear on March 10: Cong leader on AAP leading in Punjab
176.article_body: Responding to early exit polls showing Aam Aadmi Party forming the government in Punjab, Congress leader Sunil Jakhar said that the situation will be clear on March 10. As per the ABP C-Voter exit poll, AAP is ahead in Punjab and is projected to get 51-61 seats in the 117-member Assembly. The ruling Congress is projected to get 22-28 seats.

177.title: 'The Kashmir Files' is about right to justice: Vivek Agnihotri
177.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri has said his new film 'The Kashmir Files' is about the right to justice. "They [Pandit community] don't want to speak about their pain, and it's difficult to make them speak their heart out," he said. "We got testimonials from people across the globe," he added. Vivek said he plans to make 'The Delhi Files' after this.

178.title: T'gana to set up 1st women’s university, district medical colleges
178.article_body: The Telangana government on Monday announced the setting up of the first women's university in the state and also said that they will establish a medical college in every district over the next two years. During his budget speech, Finance Minister of Telangana Harish Rao said that the government has initiated measures to introduce English medium in all the schools.

179.title: Never understood the game: Swami Chakrapani on 'Lock Upp' eviction
179.article_body: After his eviction from 'Lock Upp', Swami Chakrapani has said he never quite understood the game. "I am a man who lives in solitude. I have never been put under the same roof along with so many people," he said. "Honestly, it was a surprise to me when I saw people...fighting to be seen," he added.

180.title: 1,314 Indians evacuated today from Ukraine’s neighbouring countries
180.article_body: Over 1,300 Indians were evacuated today from Ukraine's neighbouring countries by seven special civilian flights. Out of the seven flights, four landed in New Delhi, while two reached Mumbai. There were five flights from Budapest and one each from Bucharest and Suceava. More than 17,400 Indians have been brought back since February 22, according to the Ministry of Civil Aviation.

181.title: It's been a sad week: Steve Smith on deaths of Warne, Marsh
181.article_body: Following deaths of Australian cricket legends Rod Marsh and Shane Warne last week, Australia Test vice-captain Steve Smith said it was a "sad week". Warne, aged 52, died due to a suspected heart attack on Friday. Marsh, aged 74, also passed away on same day after suffering a heart attack eight days earlier. "We feel for both...Marsh...Warne family," he added.

182.title: Cong leader holds protest urging KCR to re-install Ambedkar statue
182.article_body: Congress leader V Hanumantha Rao on Monday staged a protest at the Telangana Martyrs' Memorial to urge the state government to re-install the Bhimrao Ambedkar statue at Panjagutta crossroads. Rao said that CM KCR should install the statue where it was vandalised in 2019. This comes a month after minister KT Rama Rao assured a 125-feet-tall Ambedkar statue in Hyderabad.

183.title: Body of Shane Warne transferred to Bangkok before flight to Australia
183.article_body: The body of Australian spin legend Shane Warne has been transported to Thailand's capital Bangkok before being flown back to Australia. The convoy of ambulance and police drove overnight from Surat Thani province, south of Thailand, to an airport in Bangkok. Warne passed away aged 52 at a villa on the resort island of Koh Samui.

184.title: BJP will return with a full majority in Goa: CM Pramod Sawant
184.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Monday said that BJP will return with a full majority in the state. "BJP will get 18-22 seats...and will form the government. I strongly believe people will once again choose...double engine government," said Sawant. He added that their priority was to complete the infrastructure projects and they'll fulfil the 'Aatmanirbhar Bharat Swayampurna Goa' scheme.

185.title: Medvedev won't be tennis-wise affected by Russia-Ukraine war: Mouratoglou
185.article_body: Serena Williams' coach Patrick Mouratoglou said world number one Daniil Medvedev won't get affected "tennis-wise" by ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine. "On a personal or emotional side he might be, but...don't think it's going to affect his level of play," he added. The Russian overtook Novak Djokovic to top ATP rankings for first time in his career last week.

186.title: 4 directors of TN-based firm's held for cheating people of ₹1,100 cr
186.article_body: Four directors of a Tamil Nadu-based firm were arrested by the ED for defrauding people of over ₹1,100 crore. Disc Assets Lead India Limited and Ors collected the money from public in 'Collective Investment Scheme', reportedly promising land or money with higher interest in return. The accused were identified as N Umashankar, N Arun, V Janarthanan and A Saravana Kumar.

187.title: Hundreds attend funeral of 19-yr-old killed in J&K grenade attack
187.article_body: Hundreds of people attended the funeral of 19-year-old Rafiya Jan, who was killed due to a grenade blast in Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, on Sunday. The incident reportedly took place when Jan was shopping with her mother and sister at the Amira Kadal market. The Hazratbal area resident succumbed to her multiple fatal injuries in the SMHS hospital during treatment.

188.title: 501 trees planted in MSRVVP under Ankur Abhiyan in MP's Ujjain
188.article_body: Various institutions' members and volunteers planted 501 saplings under the Ankur Abhiyan at Maharshi Sandipani Rashtriya Vedavidya Pratishthan (MSRVVP) in MP's Ujjain. The programme was inaugurated with the molshree tree, said to cure throat cancer, being planted. The trees were provided by Vasundhara Hariyali Mahotsav committee and would be looked after by gurukul students on a daily basis.

189.title: Dead, benign: Steve Smith on Rawalpindi pitch after 925 runs scored in 4 days of 1st Test
189.article_body: Reacting to 925 runs being scored and just 11 wickets taken after four days in the first Pakistan-Australia Test in Rawalpindi, Steve Smith called the pitch "pretty benign" and "dead". "I thought it would break up a little bit more and probably turn a bit more from the start, but it probably hasn't done so," he added.

190.title: Want to contribute in every way possible: Sneh on win vs Pak in Women's WC
190.article_body: India all-rounder Sneh Rana, who scored an unbeaten 53 and took 2/27 in her side's 107-run win against Pakistan in 2022 Women's ODI World Cup, said she wants to contribute to the team in every way possible. "Today [on Sunday] I did it somewhere," she added. Sneh and Pooja Vastrakar stitched a 122-run seventh-wicket stand, helping India post 244/7.

191.title: 1 constable injured in IED blast in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur
191.article_body: A district force constable was injured in an improvised explosive device (IED) blast in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur on Monday. The constable had accidentally stepped on a pressure IED while removing naxal banners, a police official said, adding, he has been admitted to a hospital and is stable. Last month, four CRPF personnel were injured in an IED blast in Bijapur.

192.title: 2, including a woman, arrested for brandishing pistols online in MP
192.article_body: Two youths, including a woman, were arrested for brandishing pistols on social media in MP's Ujjain. The two people were arrested from Vikramnagar Bridge after the woman, a student, allegedly posted a picture of herself posing with illegal firearms in both hands on Instagram to prove herself as a lady don. Her neighbour was also apprehended for providing her weapons.

193.title: Liquor prices hiked by up to ₹80 at TASMAC shops by Tamil Nadu govt
193.article_body: Tamil Nadu has increased the price of liquor at Tamil Nadu State Marketing Corporation Limited (TASMAC) shops and the hike ranges from a minimum of ₹10 to ₹80. Now, a 180 ml bottle of rum and brandy will cost ₹130 as compared to its earlier price of ₹120. The price of beer per bottle has been increased by ₹10.

194.title: Assam court directs police to register case against CM Himanta
194.article_body: A local court in Guwahati directed the police to book a case against Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma over a Congress MP's complaint. A complaint alleging that the CM made inflammatory remarks over an eviction drive was lodged by Lok Sabha MP Abdul Khaleque. He reportedly approached court after the Dispur Police station didn't register an FIR against Sarma.

195.title: Keep Saturdays free, address grievances of tax assessees: FM to CBDT, CBIC officials
195.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman rapped CBDT and CBIC for allegedly not responding to grievances of tax assessees and directed officials to reserve Saturdays to hold meetings with them. "Are you engaging with your own assessees?...Engage with them and give the clarification required," Sitharaman said. She was having a post-budget interaction with industry members and tax officers in Bengaluru.

196.title: Accounting firms EY, Deloitte sever links with Russia
196.article_body: EY and Deloitte on Monday said they will sever ties with Russia, following two other of the world's Big Four accounting firms KPMG and PwC. EY won't serve any Russian government clients, state-owned enterprises or sanctioned entities, individuals, the firm said. "We'll separate our practice in Russia, Belarus from the global network of member firms," said Deloitte CEO Punit Renjen.

197.title: Airlines urge govt to raise cap on domestic fares citing rising fuel prices
197.article_body: Airlines in India have urged the Civil Aviation Ministry to raise caps on domestic fares citing rising aviation turbine fuel (ATF)  prices. ATF, one of the biggest components of air fares, has risen 26.4% or ₹19,508.25/kl in Delhi since December 15. The Civil Aviation Ministry had temporarily set upper and lower airfare limits in the wake of the pandemic.

198.title: Gavaskar clarifies remark on Warne, says 'That wasn't the time for any comparison'
198.article_body: After facing criticism for comparing Shane Warne with other spinners following the ex-Australian cricketer's death, Sunil Gavaskar has issued clarification. Gavaskar said, "I was asked...whether Warne was the greatest spinner ever and I gave my personal, honest opinion. In hindsight, that question shouldn't have been asked nor should have been answered. That wasn't the time for any comparison."

199.title: Can't behave like a Zara store: Delhi govt defends prohibiting discounts on liquor
199.article_body: Delhi government on Monday defended its decision to discontinue discounts on liquor in the Delhi High Court while mentioning that it was becoming an "export centre" of liquor for states like Haryana and Uttar Pradesh. The advocate representing the government said, "This is alcohol. There's some responsibility and restraint. You can't behave as if it is a Zara store.”

200.title: Govt's duty to evacuate Indians without 'partisan propaganda': Cong
200.article_body: Congress on Monday said that it is the duty of the Centre to make all efforts to evacuate Indian citizens from Ukraine without "partisan propaganda". "We remain gravely concerned about the safety of thousands of Indian students and citizens trapped in war zones," Congress said. Loss of human lives, "mass exodus of people" is unacceptable, Congress further said.

201.title: Foreign Ministers of Ukraine, Russia to meet in Turkey on March 10
201.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov and his Ukrainian counterpart, Dmytro Kuleba will hold their first potential talks in Turkey's Antalya on March 10, confirmed Turkish Foreign Minister, Mevlüt Çavuşoğlu. "We especially hope this meeting is an important step towards peace, stability," said Çavuşoğlu. Meanwhile, over 400 civilians were killed in Ukraine since Russian invasion on February 24.

202.title: Russia issues list of nations that commit 'unfriendly' actions, US & UK included
202.article_body: Russia has approved a list of nations and territories that commit "unfriendly" actions against it. These include US, Canada, EU states, UK (including Jersey, Anguilla, British Virgin Islands, Gibraltar), Ukraine, Montenegro, Switzerland, Albania, Andorra, Iceland, Liechtenstein, Monaco, Norway, San Marino, North Macedonia, Japan, South Korea, Australia, Micronesia, New Zealand, Singapore, Taiwan.

203.title: Glamorgan share Viv Richards' pic from his last one-day match to mark his 70th birthday
203.article_body: English county side Glamorgan took to Twitter to share a throwback picture of Viv Richards on occasion of his 70th birthday. In the picture, Richards can be seen sitting on the floor of the dressing room seemingly exhausted after his last one-day match. Viv Richards scored an unbeaten 46 against Kent, helping Glamorgan win the tournament on September 19, 1993.

204.title: 6 workers trapped after roof of coal mine collapses in Telangana
204.article_body: As many as six workers are trapped after the roof of an underground coal mine collapsed in Telangana's Peddapalli district. The roof of the mine collapsed when workers were extracting coal in the Ramagundam region, which is a part of the Adriyala longwall project, the reports said. Security personnel have reached the spot and rescue operations are underway.

205.title: Sandalwood trees stolen from Bhopal railway magistrate's bungalow
205.article_body: Sandalwood trees were reportedly stolen by a group of burglars from the Bhopal railway special magistrate’s bungalow on Monday. The Government Railway Police said that they were informed about unusual sounds from the bungalow at around 3 am following which they arrived at the scene but were unable to find anyone. A case has been registered against unknown persons.

206.title: EU to discuss Ukraine's membership bid soon: European Council chief
206.article_body: European Union (EU) leaders will discuss Ukraine's membership bid in the coming days, European Council chief Charles Michel said on Monday. Notably, Presidents of Lithuania, Latvia, Poland and five other countries have urged expedited EU candidate country status for Ukraine following the Russian invasion. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy signed an application to join the EU last month.

207.title: Ukraine's Yastremska to donate Lyon prize money to help her war-torn country
207.article_body: Ukraine's Dayana Yastremska said she would donate her Lyon Open runner-up prize money (€14,545) to her home country to aid efforts following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The world number 103 lost to eighth-seeded Shuai Zhang 6-3, 3-6, 4-6 in final. Yastremska fled Ukraine with her younger sister with help from their parents days after invasion began on February 24.

208.title: I'd sell & buy metal scrap: Vedanta's Anil Agarwal while sharing an old picture
208.article_body: Vedanta's billionaire Chairman Anil Agarwal on Monday tweeted an old picture of him while revealing some details about his earlier days. He wrote, "I rented an 8 ft by 9 ft office in Bhoiwada (metal market) in Kalvadevi where I'd work day-in, day-out." He added, "I would sell and buy metal scrap collected from cable companies, and Bihar, my hometown."

209.title: At least 2 soldiers, 2 UN forces killed in separate attacks in Mali
209.article_body: Malian army and the UN mission in the country said at least two soldiers and two UN peacekeeping forces were killed in separate attacks on Monday. While the soldiers were attacked in the Gao region by militants, an improvised-explosive device (IED) blast hit the convoy of UN mission. This comes as Mali has been fighting Islamist insurgency for decades.

210.title: Never thought I would undergo liposuction: Amy Schumer
210.article_body: Actress-comedian Amy Schumer said she underwent liposuction and added that she never thought she would do anything like that. "Like when I would hear 'liposuction', I was just like, 'that's so crazy to me'," she stated. However, Amy decided to go for the procedure after turning 40 and having a C-section. Amy had also battled endometriosis and underwent surgery.

211.title: Dhanraj Pillay inaugurates astroturf hockey field at INS Shivaji
211.article_body: Former hockey captain Dhanraj Pillay inaugurated the astroturf hockey field at the country's premier marine engineering training institute, INS Shivaji, in Lonavala. Along with Pillay, Navy veteran and hockey coach, Avtar Singh, also inaugurated the astroturf field. Later, a match was played that featured current and former hockey players.

212.title: 'F*** off & go home, Putin', says actress Megan at Spirit Awards; video surfaces
212.article_body: During the Spirit Awards ceremony held on Sunday, host Megan Mullally said, "I think we speak for everyone here when we say we are hoping for a quick and peaceful resolution (in Ukraine)." She added, "Specifically, f*** off and go home, Putin." Her husband and co-host Nick Offerman said, "That is the quick and peaceful resolution we're talking about."

213.title: Poland to set up $1.75 billion fund to help refugees from Ukraine
213.article_body: Poland has approved a draft bill for creating a fund of $1.75 billion to help war refugees from Ukraine. The legislation seeks to allow funding of food, temporary lodging, as well as allowing refugees to legally work there. According to the UN, over 1.7 million people have fled Ukraine following Russian invasion, the majority of whom have arrived in Poland.

214.title: Best employers don't support bloodshed: Ukraine to Amazon Founder Bezos
214.article_body: Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov has written an open letter to Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos urging him to suspend provisions of Amazon Web Services in Russia amid war. "I believe that the best employers...would never support bloodshed and disinformation," Fedorov said. He also wrote that many Ukrainians are working for Amazon globally and they need the company's support today.

215.title: My father said 'Shane Warne can't die, it's Warnie': Brett Lee
215.article_body: Former Australia fast bowler Brett Lee said that he was at his parents' place when he came to know about Shane Warne's demise through former England spinner Graeme Swann. "When I told my dad, he summed it beautifully, he said, 'Warnie can't die. It's Warnie.'" Warne passed away at age of 52 in Thailand.

216.title: They're easy as they're poor: Brazil politician's remarks on Ukrainian women go viral
216.article_body: A Brazil politician's comments on fleeing Ukrainian women, as heard on leaked audio, are going viral. Arthur do Val said, "I’ve never seen anything like it in terms of beautiful girls. The refugee queue…just total goddesses…The queue outside Brazil’s best nightclub...doesn't come close to the refugee queue here. He added, "Let me tell you, they're easy because they're poor."

217.title: MP woman consumes poison after police try to remove encroachment
217.article_body: A woman in Madhya Pradesh's Dhar, who allegedly ran a kiosk on government property, consumed a poisonous substance after police reportedly arrived with JCB machine to remove the encroachment. She was taken to the hospital where she is said to be out of danger. Dhar tehsildar, Vinod Rathore, said the department had earlier issued notice to her following locals' complaints.

218.title: Biggest threat to Test cricket are dead pitches: Jaffer on Rawalpindi Test
218.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer has taken a dig at Rawalpindi pitch being used in ongoing first Test between Pakistan and Australia. "Biggest threat to Test cricket are dead pitches. Dead pitch = dead game," he tweeted. Pakistan declared their first innings at 476/4. In reply, Australia have scored 449/7 and trail by 27 runs heading into fifth and final day.

219.title: SL will take time to bridge Test cricket gap between them, India: Gambhir
219.article_body: Gautam Gambhir said it'll take a long time for Sri Lanka to bridge the gap between them and India in Test cricket as India have been dominating. He stated that long time ago there wasn't much difference when India and Sri Lanka used to play in subcontinent. Sri Lanka lost first Test by an innings and 222 runs against India.

220.title: 'Sa Re Ga Ma Pa' host Aditya Narayan quits show after 15 yrs, says 'time flies'
220.article_body: Actor-singer Aditya Narayan has said he will no longer host the singing reality show 'Sa Re Ga Ma Pa', ending his 15-year association with the show. Saying that he was bidding adieu to the show "with a heavy heart", Narayan added, "From an 18-year-old teenager to a young man with a beautiful wife and baby daughter!...Time really does fly."

221.title: Fully grown Snow Leopard spotted in Spiti Valley in rare sighting; ITBP shares video
221.article_body: A fully grown Snow Leopard was spotted by Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) troops in Himachal Pradesh's Spiti Valley at 12,500 feet. Sharing the video of the sighting on Twitter, ITBP's official Twitter handle tweeted, "Rare sight of a rare species." It added, "ITBP is committed to preserve and restore flora and fauna in the Himalayan region."

222.title: 163 Karnataka students still stuck in Ukraine: State govt
222.article_body: The Karnataka government on Monday said 476 students have returned from Ukraine, while at least 163 are still stranded. "On 51 flights under Operation Ganga, 476 students from the state have returned. There are some students who are in Mumbai. Another five to six flights are scheduled today," said Karnataka State Disaster Management Authority Commissioner Manoj Rajan.

223.title: Activision Blizzard sued for wrongful death of female employee
223.article_body: The parents of 32-year-old Activision Blizzard employee Kerri Moynihan are suing the company for her wrongful death. Moynihan was found dead in a hotel room at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel in 2017. Her parents alleged the "hostile, intimidating, offensive, and abusive" workplace she experienced was a "significant factor" that contributed to her suicide, The Washington Post reported.

224.title: Need to check who’s arriving: PM on entry of Ukraine refugees in UK
224.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson on Monday rejected calls to ease visa restrictions on Ukrainians fleeing Russian invasion of their country, citing need to maintain checks on who's arriving in UK. "We're a...generous country. What we want though is control," he said. His remarks come after France accused UK of turning away 150 Ukrainians who wanted to join their families there.

225.title: Bengal Guv physically assaulted by TMC leaders in Assembly: Suvendu
225.article_body: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari on Monday alleged that West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar was physically assaulted by TMC leaders on the first day of the Budget Session. "We'll meet Governor. He should take appropriate action against it. If necessary, will consult with [Centre]," Suvendu added. A ruckus erupted in the Assembly after the Opposition protested against violence in municipal polls.

226.title: The Batman was phenomenal, Zoe is Catwoman of dreams: Taylor Swift
226.article_body: Taking to Instagram Stories, singer Taylor Swift has said that actress Zoe Kravitz, who plays Selina Kyle in 'The Batman', is the Catwoman of dreams. "The Batman was phenomenal," Taylor further wrote. Actor Robert Pattinson portrays the role of Bruce Wayne, who is the Batman in the film. 'The Batman' is directed by Matt Reeves.

227.title: Alliance with SP will depend on circumstances: Priyanka Vadra
227.article_body: Congress National General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has said that an alliance with Samajwadi Party in Uttar Pradesh will depend on circumstances. "We are waiting for the results and will make the decision according to the situation," she said. Speaking about Congress' chances of forming the government in UP, Gandhi said that Congress has "good chances in all the states."

228.title: Robbers escape with cash, jewels worth ₹6 cr from bank in K'taka
228.article_body: Unidentified persons broke into the District Central Cooperative Bank at Murgod in Karnataka and escaped with cash and valuables worth ₹6 crores on Saturday night, the police said. "We are probing the case. There was no forced entry into the bank and the lockers were not broken. They used keys to open it," a police officer said.

229.title: Over 400 civilians killed, 801 injured in Ukraine: UN
229.article_body: Office of UN High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR) said 406 civilians were killed in Ukraine since Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24 as of Sunday midnight. UN human rights office added that 801 residents were injured in Ukraine so far. However, OHCHR said the real figures might be considerably higher "especially in government-controlled territory and especially in recent days".

230.title: Disclose AGM voting results within 24 hours: SEBI to Dish TV
230.article_body: SEBI has ordered Dish TV to disclose the voting results of its annual general meeting (AGM), held on December 30, in the next 24 hours. It also issued show cause notices and ordered depositories to freeze Demat accounts of the company's directors and compliance officer. Dish TV didn't disclose AGM voting results citing a pending case in the Bombay HC.

231.title: Empty seats speak loudly: Ukrainian envoy as Russia skips ICJ hearing
231.article_body: Russia on Monday skipped a hearing at the International Court of Justice (ICJ) where Ukraine has appealed for an immediate halt on Moscow's invasion. Ukrainian envoy Anton Korynevych said, "The fact that Russia's seats are empty speaks loudly. They are not here in this court of law- they are on a battlefield waging an aggressive war against my country."

232.title: BJP MLAs create ruckus during Governor's address in WB Assembly
232.article_body: BJP MLAs created ruckus during Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar's address in the West Bengal Assembly on Monday over alleged rigging in the civic elections. The incident's video shows them raising 'Jai Shri Ram' and 'Bharat Mata ki Jai' slogans during the Governor's inaugural address to the House. The governor was seen pleading with the MLAs to allow the proceedings to start.

233.title: Over 2.6 lakh Ukrainians escaped to Romania since Russia invaded
233.article_body: The police officials at the Ukraine-Romania border said a total of 2,61,445 Ukrainians have escaped to Romania since Russian invasion of the country on February 24. The officials added the residents entered Romania through its land border checkpoints with Ukraine and Moldova. Reportedly, out of the total citizens who had fled Ukraine, 1,82,312 lakh have already left Romania.

234.title: MP newspaper owner Pyare Miyan gets life imprisonment for raping minors
234.article_body: A court in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal on Monday sentenced newspaper owner Pyare Miyan to life imprisonment for raping minor girls. The Afkar daily owner, who is aged around 70, was arrested from Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar in July 2020. Police had found some minor girls in an unconscious state on the outskirts of Bhopal, following which he was booked.

235.title: My vulnerabilities are my strength, not weakness: Shruti Haasan
235.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan has said that her vulnerabilities are her strength and not her weakness. Shruti added that women tend to project strength or wear an armour of humour during their vulnerabilities. "You have to wake up and feel stronger than appear stronger than your feeling," she stated. Shruti said she did that to herself for a long period.

236.title: 45th Chennai Book Fair concludes, books worth ₹12 crore sold
236.article_body: The 45th Chennai Book Fair that was being held at YMCA grounds, Nandanam, concluded on Sunday. The 19-day long fair recorded a footfall of 15 lakh people and the sale of books worth ₹12 crore, Booksellers and Publishers Association of South India (BAPASI) said. The fair had 800 stalls, including those set up to promote Tamil Nadu government’s education-at-doorstep scheme.

237.title: Harjot Singh, shot at 4 times in Ukraine, brought back to India; video surfaces
237.article_body: Delhi's Harjot Singh, who was shot at four times in Ukraine's Kyiv, was brought back to India on Monday, onboard an IAF flight. Union Minister VK Singh said that Harjot's condition is stable and that he is referred to RR hospital for treatment. A video showed Harjot being assisted off the aircraft after arriving at the Hindon Airport in Ghaziabad.

238.title: US Airbnb host takes over 2,000 videos & pics of guests having sex via hidden camera
238.article_body: A 54-year-old Airbnb host in the US has been charged for allegedly spying on guests having sex and recording over 2,000 videos and photos for a year. As per the police, a guest found the hidden camera, which was disguised as a power adapter. Meanwhile, his lawyer claimed he was innocent of all the charges.

239.title: UP sees 54.18% voter turnout till 5pm in final phase of Assembly polls
239.article_body: Uttar Pradesh recorded a voter turnout of 54.18% till 5 pm in the seventh and the final phase of the Assembly elections on Monday. PM Narendra Modi's parliamentary seat Varanasi saw 52.79% polling in this period. Fifty-four seats spread across nine districts -- Azamgarh, Mau, Jaunpur, Ghazipur, Chandauli, Varanasi, Mirzapur, Bhadohi and Sonbhadra -- voted on Monday.

240.title: To be part of it is achievement: Boman on pic with Big B, Anupam
240.article_body: Actor Boman Irani on Monday took to Instagram to share a picture with veteran actors Amitabh Bachchan, Anupam Kher and Danny Denzongpa. Boman captioned it, "To be part of this iconic picture is an achievement in itself." The actor further wrote that being a part of the upcoming film 'Uunchai' makes his heart glow with humble pride.

241.title: What we've so far in H'wood is stereotypical: Spider-Man's Zoha Rahman
241.article_body: Actress Zoha Rahman, the first Marvel film character to wear a hijab in 'Spider-Man: No Way Home', has said that what we have seen of South Asian actors in Hollywood is very stereotypical. "Firstly, you don't see more than one South Asian on-screen because it either has to be a South Asian or black or East Asian," the actress added.

242.title: Paytm's market cap falls below ₹50,000 cr as shares hit record low
242.article_body: The market capitalisation of Paytm's parent One97 Communications fell below ₹50,000 crore on Monday as the company's shares hit record low of ₹751. Paytm's market capitalisation stood at ₹48,785 crore as its shares ended 4.15% lower on the NSE on March 7. Paytm made its stock market debut in November 2021 and its shares have declined nearly 65% since then.

243.title: From size zero to size 16, I've enjoyed every phase of life: Kareena
243.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor has said that going from size zero to size 16, she has thoroughly lived and enjoyed every phase of her life. The actress further said that during her pregnancy, she gained 25 kgs of weight but never allowed that to interfere with doing the things that she loves. "I've had...fun being confident in my skin," Kareena added.

244.title: Sachin Bansal's Navi to file for ₹4,000-cr IPO this week: Report
244.article_body: Financial services company Navi Technologies is planning to file draft papers with SEBI for ₹4,000-crore initial public offer (IPO) this week, PTI reported. The issue is expected to open in June and will be a fresh issuance of equity shares with no offer-for-sale component. Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal co-founded Navi with Ankit Agarwal after exiting the e-commerce startup in 2018.

245.title: Yemen's Houthi rebels fire at least 1 missile in Red Sea: US Navy
245.article_body: US Navy on Monday said Yemen's Houthi rebels fired at least one missile in Red Sea on Saturday, March 5. "Although maritime traffic was not impacted, these actions are destabilising and present a danger to all vessels," added the navy. Iran-backed rebel group has fired missiles, bombs in the sea since it seized Yemen's capital Sana'a in 2014.

246.title: China plans to use reusable rockets for manned space missions: Report
246.article_body: China Aerospace Science and Technology (CASC), a state-owned firm plans to use reusable rockets to carry country's new Shenzhou spacecraft for manned missions, reported Space.com. As per the report, the reusable rocket will come in two variants, two-stage for manned missions and three-stage for deep space voyages. Reportedly, tethered landing devices will be deployed during rocket's landing phase.

247.title: Megalodon may have grown to larger sizes in cooler waters: US study
247.article_body: US study revealed Otodus Megalodon, world's largest shark that lived upto 3.6 million years ago may have grown to larger sizes in cooler waters than in warmer areas. "Our findings suggest a previously unrecognised body size pattern following a geography-driven ecological pattern..." said study co-author Kenshu Shimada. Team added the species that lived in cooler areas were 18-20 metres long.

248.title: AAP likely to sweep Punjab, BJP to retain Uttar Pradesh: Exit Polls
248.article_body: Exit polls said AAP will form government in Punjab with India Today-Axis poll predicting 76-90 seats, while News24-Today's Chanakya giving it 89-111 seats. For UP, exit polls predicted a return to power for BJP with NewsX and Republic P-Marq exit polls predicting over 200 seats for the party. Axis poll predicted BJP win in Uttarakhand while CVoter predicted Congress' lead.

249.title: Djokovic contacts Ukrainian tennis player Sergiy to offer help; he shares chat
249.article_body: Novak Djokovic reached out to Ukrainian former world number 31 tennis player Sergiy Stakhovsky and offered financial support and any other help required by him amid the Russia-Ukraine war. Stakhovsky posted a screenshot on Instagram of his conversation with Djokovic via WhatsApp, where Djokovic asked him, "Stako, how are you man?...Thinking of you...hoping all calms down soon."

250.title: Second copyright case filed against Dua Lipa's 'Levitating'
250.article_body: A second copyright lawsuit has been filed against singer Dua Lipa's song 'Levitating' in a Manhattan federal court. Songwriters L Russell Brown and Sandy Linzer accused Dua of copying the opening melody of 'Levitating' from their 1979 song 'Wiggle and Giggle All Night' and 1980 song 'Don Diablo'. Earlier band Artikal Sound System accused her of stealing their 2017 song.

251.title: My career is made up of roles that were rejected by others: Swara
251.article_body: Actress Swara Bhasker has said that her filmography is made up of roles that were rejected by other actresses. "In 'Raanjhanaa', I was the last person to be cast because they had a sudden last-minute cancellation," Swara stated. "[In] 'Prem Ratan Dhan Payo', no actress wanted to play actor Salman Khan's sister, so they reached out to me," she added.

252.title: NZ know what's coming up: Devine ahead of Women's WC game vs India
252.article_body: Ahead of upcoming New Zealand-India match in 2022 Women's World Cup, New Zealand captain Sophie Devine said her side knows what's coming up. The match will be played on Thursday. Last month, New Zealand defeated India in a one-off T20I and 4-1 in a five-match ODI series in Queenstown. Earlier today, New Zealand beat Bangladesh by nine wickets.

253.title: Improve laws governing military engagement with nations: China's Xi
253.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Monday told the military to enhance use of laws in their relations with nations. "Improve the laws and regulations governing military engagement with foreign countries," said Xi, who is also the Commander-in-Chief for the country's military forces. The remarks came during a meeting with the representatives of military in parliament.

254.title: I got breast surgery at 15-16, that was very scary: Rakhi Sawant
254.article_body: Actress Rakhi Sawant has said that she underwent breast surgery when she was around 15-16 years old, adding it was very scary. "I was a kid and totally flat...So I [lay] down in an operation theatre and became a cold-to-hot girl," she added. Rakhi further said that at the time she was told it was important to enter Bollywood.

255.title: Squid Game's Lee Jung Jae wins best actor at Independent Spirit Awards
255.article_body: South Korean actor Lee Jung Jae has won the Best Male Performance in a New Scripted Series award at the Independent Spirit Awards 2022 for his role in 'Squid Game'. He had earlier become the first Korean male actor to win the award for Outstanding Performance by an Actor in a Drama Series at the 28th Screen Actors Guild Awards.

256.title: Aishwaryaa Rajinikanth hospitalised after having fever, vertigo
256.article_body: Veteran actor Rajinikanth's daughter Aishwaryaa on Monday took to Instagram to share a picture of her in the hospital along with neurosurgeon Dr Prithika Chary. She wrote, "Life before covid and post covid. Back again in the hospital experiencing fever and vertigo and what not!" Aishwaryaa had tested positive for COVID-19 last month and had to be hospitalised.

257.title: 11-yr-old Ukraine boy with phone number written on hand travels 1,000 km alone
257.article_body: An 11-year-old boy from Ukraine's Zaporizhzhya covered over 1,000 km alone to reach Slovakia amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict. With one plastic bag, passport, his mother's note and a phone number written on his hand, he travelled alone because his parents reportedly had to take care of a sick relative in Ukraine. He was supposed to find his relatives in Slovakia.

258.title: Very odd reaction: Benedict on Sam Elliott's 'The Power...' criticism
258.article_body: Actor Benedict Cumberbatch has reacted to actor Sam Elliott's criticism of Benedict's film 'The Power of the Dog'. "I'm trying...hard not to say anything about a very odd reaction that happened the other day on a radio podcast," Benedict stated without taking Sam's name. This comes after Sam had called Benedict's film "a piece of s**t" on a podcast.

259.title: Telangana has proved to be India's economic powerhouse: TRS leader
259.article_body: Telangana has proved to be the economic powerhouse of the country, CM K Chandrashekar Rao's daughter and TRS leader Kavitha Kalvakuntla said on Monday. "When Telangana was formed in 2014, we had to re-orient and re-invent...state...we started with...budget of ₹1 lakh crore which is today at ₹2.56 lakh crore," she added. We've made tremendous progress across sectors, she further said.

260.title: There were two victims in 'Rust' shooting incident: Alec Baldwin
260.article_body: Actor Alec Baldwin, speaking about the shooting incident on the sets of 'Rust' which killed cinematographer Halyna Hutchins in October last year, said that there were two victims in the incident. Talking about the lawsuits filed over the incident, Baldwin stated, "We have people that are suing people that they think are deep pockets litigants."

261.title: In Indian conditions, he's unstoppable: Jaffer on Ravindra Jadeja
261.article_body: Following Ravindra Jadeja's 175* and 9/87 in India-Sri Lanka first Test, Wasim Jaffer said the India all-rounder is unstoppable in home conditions. "Jadeja is arguably one of the best all-rounders in the world...even overseas, he can perform at number seven the way his batting has improved," he added. India are 1-0 ahead in two-match Test series against Sri Lanka.

262.title: I'll not judge Vihari on what he did on Mohali wicket: Gambhir on 1st Test
262.article_body: Following Hanuma Vihari's 58 in his first innings while batting at number three for India in first Test against Sri Lanka, Gautam Gambhir said he'll not judge Vihari based on his performance in Mohali. "I'll judge him on what he has done overall in Test cricket to date because all batters...even Mohammad Shami, looked comfortable on this pitch," he added.

263.title: Assume tough times ahead, be prepared: Zoho CEO to staff amid Russia-Ukraine war
263.article_body: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu on Monday tweeted some advice that he had shared with this staff amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict. Vembu wrote, "The world faces many serious challenges…While our company is on a...healthy foundation...we have weathered two serious downturns in our 25-year history...Assume...tough times will be ahead and be prepared…We don't know what lies ahead. Expect turbulent times."

264.title: Power outage in Mumbai's Colaba, electricity restored in phases
264.article_body: Days after a massive power failure in parts of Mumbai, Colaba witnessed a power outage on Sunday night. "Yesterday three 11 kilovolt fault occurred in Colaba area, due to this around 19 Distribution Sub Stations (DSS) were affected," the BEST said. Electricity in 70% of areas was restored immediately, while the remaining places took time.

265.title: Choreographer Tushar Kalia announces engagement to Triveni Barman
265.article_body: Choreographer Tushar Kalia, known for judging 'Dance Deewane' along with actress Madhuri Dixit, on Monday announced his engagement to Triveni Barman. Tushar shared a picture with Triveni on social media, writing, "She said yes. Couldn't have asked for anything else on my birthday." Madhuri along with actress Mouni Roy congratulated the couple in the comment section.

266.title: Priest assaults man for entering Hyd temple's 'prohibited' area, held
266.article_body: A priest has been arrested for assaulting a devotee at a temple in Secunderabad after the man reportedly entered a prohibited area. The incident was said to have taken place on February 27 at Ganesh Temple, when the temple was crowded with devotees and temple staff. The priest allegedly yelled at the victim and even beat him up.

267.title: Rao shares post of man in Hyd hospital, says he'll assist him
267.article_body: Telangana Finance Minister Thanneeru Harish Rao on Sunday shared the post of a man hospitalised in Hyderabad with clotting in his brain and said that his "team would assist" him. The post, originally shared online by an MBT spokesperson, had a picture of 36-year-old Mohd Abdul Rizwan in KIMS Secunderabad. It revealed that the patient is being charged ₹1 lakh/day.

268.title: 929 immunisation booths for kids open from today in Gurugram
268.article_body: 929 immunisation booths for children have opened from today across different health centres as part of a week-long immunisation drive in Gurugram, the district health department said. "Vaccines will be given to children up to the age of 16 years," said district immunisation officer Dr MP Singh. Children can get vaccines for diseases like hepatitis-B, rotavirus, polio and Japanese encephalitis.

269.title: Central GST adjudged winner at inter-office athletics meet in Pune
269.article_body: The Poona inter-office athletics meet was held in Pune's Indrayani Nagar on Sunday. The annual event had competitions such as running, shot put and long jump. Central GST's Akshay Khot won both 100m and 200m events for men while Shyamrao Daundkar won the 400m and 800m events. Meanwhile, Chaitrali Gujar, also of Central GST won the women's 100m event.

270.title: Light rain in Pune on March 8 & 9, cloudy conditions to continue: IMD
270.article_body: Pune will receive light rain on March 8 and 9, according to a report by the India Meteorological Department (IMD). Mornings will have partly cloudy conditions, turning to cloudy skies post afternoon hours over Pune and other areas in the coming days, the report added. Other districts that are likely to experience similar conditions include Sindhudurg, Nashik, Jalgaon and Ahmednagar.

271.title: Delhi Police constable beats dog to death with baseball bat; arrested
271.article_body: A Delhi Police constable allegedly beat a stray dog to death with a baseball bat on Sunday night, following which he has been arrested, officials said. The dog would bark at the policeman and his family every time they passed through the neighbourhood and he felt threatened, officials said. Locals alerted the police after the incident.

272.title: There's stage Madhuri, there's another who's homebody: Madhuri Dixit
272.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit has said that there is a stage Madhuri who is in front of the camera and there's another Madhuri who is a homebody. "You lose somebody close to you and that sorrow is right there in you. But then you have to go on a set and do a scene that is the complete opposite," Madhuri added.

273.title: As a captain, I want to use Jadeja a lot more with the bat: Rohit
273.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma said he wants to use all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja "a lot more" with the bat. "We all know his bowling and everyone knows about his fielding. To me, he is one of the top (all-rounders) definitely," Rohit stated. Jadeja scored an unbeaten 175 runs and took nine wickets in the first Test match against Sri Lanka.

274.title: Can't tell you anything as I've no idea: Rohit on why Ashwin didn't play Tests in England
274.article_body: Addressing a reporter's query about Ravichandran Ashwin not being a regular in India's playing XI in away Tests, Rohit Sharma said, "I can't tell you anything about his overseas place." He added, "I honestly have no idea. I wasn't part of selection at that time." Notably, Ashwin wasn't included in any of India's away Tests against England last year.

275.title: It's cheating: BJP MLA on Dabbewala Bhavan's location in Mumbai
275.article_body: BJP MLA Ashish Shelar has criticised the Shiv Sena-led BMC for setting up the Dabbewala Bhavan in Mumbai's Khar area, far away from suburban railway station. Taking to Twitter, Shelar claimed that it was set up by closing an existing COVID-19 vaccination centre and that it was "cheating" with dabbewalas. "BJP will erect...new bhavan...when we come to power," he added.

276.title: Father allegedly kills daughter for refusing to marry man of his choice
276.article_body: Indradeo Ram, along with his two brothers, allegedly slit his 19-year-old daughter's throat after she refused to marry the man of Ram's choice. The daughter's body was later dumped at an agricultural field in Bihar's Kotwa village late on Sunday, police said. Kalawati, Ram's wife, said her daughter wanted to marry another boy, with whom she was supposedly in love.

277.title: Philippines raises age of sexual consent from 12 to 16
277.article_body: Philippines has raised age of sexual consent from 12 to 16, President Rodrigo Duterte's office said on Monday. Under new law, sexual activity between adult and person aged 16 or lower will be considered statutory rape. Exceptions will be made for couples aged over 13 if their age difference doesn't exceed three years and sex is proven to be consensual.

278.title: Angelina in Yemen to aid refugees, calls it worst humanitarian crisis
278.article_body: Actress and philanthropist Angelina Jolie took to Instagram to share that she has reached Yemen's Aden amid what she called "one of the worst humanitarian crises in the world." She wrote in her caption, "As we continue to watch the horrors unfolding in Ukraine...I'm here in Yemen to support people who also desperately need peace.

279.title: BJP MLAs suspended from T'gana Assembly on Budget Session's 1st day
279.article_body: All three BJP MLAs were suspended for the rest of the Telangana Legislative Assembly session on the first day of the Budget Session on Monday. The MLAs were charged with disrupting the budget speech. The MLAs, T Raja Singh, M Raghunandan Rao and Eatala Rajender, later protested outside the Assembly against the suspension.

280.title: Apply for a valid licence to operate cabs in Maharashtra: Bombay HC to Ola, Uber
280.article_body:
The Bombay High Court has directed cab aggregators including Uber India and Ola to apply for a licence under Motor Vehicles Aggregator Guidelines, 2020, to ply their cabs in Maharashtra. It is "complete lawlessness" that aggregators are operating without a valid licence, the court observed.
The court has asked aggregators to apply for a new licence by March 16.

281.title: Maha Council briefly adjourned over call for action against Pune SP
281.article_body: The Maharashtra Legislative Council was adjourned for 10 minutes on Monday after BJP demanded action against Pune SP Abhinav Deshmukh. BJP member Gopichand Padalkar questioned the SP's decision of transferring a constable on the grounds of him having an extramarital affair. "How can the transfer order mention the woman's name...when [it's] regarding the constable", he said.

282.title: He was soft-spoken, made me feel comfortable: Girl who interacted with PM in Pune
282.article_body: Seven-year-old Shreya Gadhve described her interaction with Prime Minister Narendra Modi during his Sunday ride in the Pune Metro as "short but memorable". Gadhve, who's a student of Poona School for Blind Girls, said the PM was very humble and "soft-spoken" and made her feel comfortable. "Modiji even complimented me for my dress," she added.

283.title: Man Utd can't drop any more points in Premier League: Ralf Rangnick
283.article_body: Following a 4-1 loss against Manchester City, Manchester United head coach Ralf Rangnick has said that his side cannot drop points in the Premier League to have a chance for a top-four finish. "We also know that in those 10 games...we have to play, there are a few other difficult ones so let's take it game by game," Rangnick stated.

284.title: There's no contest in Varanasi South, people will elect BJP: MLA
284.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Minister Neelkanth Tiwari, who is also the incumbent MLA from Varanasi South, said on Monday that there's "no fierce battle" in constituency, adding that people will elect BJP. Tiwari stated that people of Varanasi share special bond with PM Narendra Modi, who has authorised several developmental works. Polling for last phase of UP Assembly elections was held today.

285.title: SP-SBSP will win 45-47 seats in Purvanchal region: SBSP chief
285.article_body: The SP-SBSP alliance in Uttar Pradesh "will win 45-47 seats in the Purvanchal region", said SBSP chief OP Rajbhar. "We're winning on five of eight seats in Varanasi, three of four seats in Chandauli, seven of nine seats in Jaunpur," he added. BJP and BSP won't win a single seat in Ballia, Mau, Azamgarh, Ambedkar Nagar and Ghazipur, he said.

286.title: Setting an example for sportswomen across globe: Smriti on Pak's Bismah
286.article_body: Praising Bismah Maroof for returning to playing cricket post giving birth to a baby girl, India Women opener Smriti Mandhana said Pakistan Women captain is setting an example for sportswomen across the globe. "Coming back post pregnancy in six months...playing international cricket is so inspiring," she added. India beat Pakistan by 107 runs in their 2022 Women's World Cup opener.

287.title: Rafael Nadal can do anything he wants on the court: Marcos Giron
287.article_body: American tennis player Marcos Giron said that he was surprised by Rafael Nadal's shot selection during their match in the Australian Open 2022. "You feel that Nadal can do anything that he wants on the court but he always makes the right decision," Giron added. Nadal defeated Giron 6-1, 6-4, 6-2 in the first round of the Australian Open 2022.

288.title: SC to hear plea by UPSC aspirants for extra attempt on March 21
288.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday said it will hear a plea on March 21 filed by UPSC aspirants who had missed their civil services exam due to COVID-19 and sought an additional attempt. It adjourned the matter after UPSC counsel sought time to seek instruction on the issue. The court asked parties concerned to file an affidavit on the plea.

289.title: Samsung Galaxy devices' source code breached by hackers
289.article_body: Samsung Electronics on Monday said that it suffered a cybersecurity breach that exposed the company's internal data, including source code for the operation of its Galaxy smartphones. Samsung didn't identify the hackers, however, it said measures to prevent further breaches have been put in place. The hack doesn't include the personal information of consumers or employees, Samsung said.

290.title: 2 Muslim men beaten up in Gurugram's Sector 45: Police
290.article_body: Gurugram Police on Monday said two Muslim men were allegedly beaten up by two unidentified men near Ramada Hotel in Gurugram's Sector 45 on Sunday night. The victims alleged that the accused made derogatory remarks on their religion and snatched their phones. One of the victims alleged that the accused forcibly put a white powdery substance in his mouth.

291.title: Low voter turnout in UP due to improper arrangements: Cong leader
291.article_body: Congress leader Ajay Rai on Monday alleged the voter turnout was low in the last phase of Uttar Pradesh elections due to lack of proper arrangements by the administration. "Not many people can be seen...unlike earlier elections," he claimed after casting his vote in Varanasi. "People are forced to stand in the open...[they] don't seem to be excited," he added.

292.title: Drunk bouncer abuses, beats up petrol pump worker in Mumbai; held
292.article_body: A drunk man, who is a bouncer by profession, allegedly beat up a petrol pump employee in Mumbai's Kandivali around 4 am on Monday. After filling the petrol, the employee asked the bouncer to be seated in the car but he didn't listen and instead assaulted the petrol pump employee. The accused also hurled abuses and slurs at him.

293.title: Video shows 2 Ukrainian soldiers getting married amid war with Russia
293.article_body: Amid the ongoing situation in Ukraine, a video has surfaced on social media that showed a pair of soldiers getting married near Kyiv. The video showed Lesya and Valeriy in military uniform and surrounded by other soldiers as they sang local songs. Vitali Klitschko, Kyiv's mayor and former world heavyweight boxing champion, also visited the area to congratulate the couple.

294.title: Prez Kovind to award Nari Shakti Puraskars to 29 women tomorrow
294.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind will confer the Nari Shakti Puraskars on 29 outstanding individuals for 2020 and 2021 on International Women's Day on Tuesday. "These achievers have not allowed age, geographical barriers or access to resources to come in the way of fulfilling their dreams," a statement by the Ministry of Women and Child Development said.

295.title: New Zealand imposes sanctions on Russian PM, President Putin
295.article_body: New Zealand Foreign Ministry on Monday introduced travel bans against Russian President Vladimir Putin, PM Mikhail Mishustin and 100 other leaders. As per ministry, PM Jacinda Ardern also announced targeted travel bans against top Russian officials including Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov. Government also said it will bring a law to impose first-ever sanctions against any country.

296.title: Grammarly, founded by Ukrainians, to donate all money made in Russia since 2014
296.article_body: Typing assistant Grammarly, whose Co-founders are Ukrainians, is donating all of the money it earned from Russia and Belarus, since the war started in 2014 through 2022, to causes supporting Ukraine. Grammarly will donate $5 million to organisations and funds defending and supporting the people of Ukraine. "We have many team members who call Ukraine home," the company said.

297.title: Indian investors lose ₹29 lakh cr wealth since February, more than Ukraine's GDP
297.article_body: Indian investors have lost ₹29 lakh crore of wealth since the beginning of February amid heightening geopolitical tensions between Russia and Ukraine and oil prices touching a 13-year high. The wealth lost by Indian investors is a lot more than Ukraine's GDP, which was estimated at $181 billion (nearly ₹15 lakh crore) in 2021, according to the Statista website.

298.title: Europe still has room for further sanctions against Russia: France
298.article_body: French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire on Monday said Europe and France still have room to implement further sanctions against Russia for invading Ukraine last month. "Yes there are margins for manoeuvre. All options are on the table," Le Maire added. Till date, European Union (EU) has imposed three packages of sanctions including freezing assets of Russian central bank.

299.title: Bengaluru recorded 146 new COVID cases, 2 deaths on March 6
299.article_body: Karnataka's Bengaluru on Sunday recorded 146 new COVID-19 cases and two coronavirus-related deaths in the last 24 hours. Data shared by the BBMP shows total 138 people recovered from the virus or were discharged on March 6, Sunday. The data also revealed that a total of 27,402 COVID-19 vaccination doses were administered in the city in the last 24 hours.

300.title: MS Dhoni begins preparations for IPL 2022 in Surat, CSK share pics
300.article_body: With IPL 2022 set to begin on March 26, CSK took to Instagram to share a few stories of the team's training session. In the stories, MS Dhoni can be seen preparing for the tournament. The CSK captain along with a few players including Ambati Rayudu had reached Surat last week. CSK will take on KKR in the tournament's opener.

301.title: That's the only thing I didn't like: Khawaja on Pak fans cheering his dismissal
301.article_body: Talking about his experience of playing in Pakistan, Australia's Usman Khawaja expressed his gratitude towards Islamabad for their hospitality. Khawaja, however, also jokingly said the only thing that he didn't like was when the crowd cheered after he got out for 97 during their first innings in the ongoing Test. "[Everyone] cheered when DRS showed I was out," he stated.

302.title: NASA studies 50-year-old lunar rock samples to plan a return to Moon
302.article_body: NASA is set to analyse the last, sealed lunar rock samples from 50 years ago to know more about the Moon and plan a return to its surface. Last month, scientists started the process by extracting lunar gases stored inside a container housing samples. NASA said team will analyse soil, rocks from the container after gas extraction process is completed.

303.title: Coal India plans to become net-zero emitter in 3-4 years: Chairman
303.article_body: Coal India Chairman, Pramod Agrawal on Monday said the government-owned mining company plans to become net-zero carbon emitter in three to four years. During the 15th Indian Coal Markets Conference, Agrawal said the firm's renewable energy projects, cleaner transport and greater internal energy efficiency are expected to contribute to the target. India aims to achieve net-zero target by 2070.

304.title: Hyderabad to get its 1st female SHO on International Women's Day
304.article_body: Hyderabad Police is set to appoint their first female Station House Officer (SHO) on the occasion of International Women's Day on Tuesday, Hyderabad Police Commissioner CV Anand said. He added that the police will appoint more women to their workforce in the coming days. "We hope that of...total police force, 20-30%...are female constables and sub-inspectors," Anand further said.

305.title: Indian refuses to leave Ukraine without his pet panther & jaguar
305.article_body: Orthopaedic doctor Girikumar Patil, popularly known as Jaguar Kumar, who hails from India's Andhra Pradesh has refused to leave Ukraine without his pet jaguar and panther. Saying that he didn't get a "proper response" when he contacted the Indian embassy, Kumar added, "Until my last moment I'll...protect them. There's no way I'll leave the kids (his pets) behind."

306.title: Oil prices touch highest level since 2008, jump close to $140 mark
306.article_body: Oil prices continued to soar on Monday after reports said the US and European allies are planning to ban Russian oil imports over its invasion of Ukraine. In the first few minutes of trade on Monday, Brent crude hit $139.13/barrel while West Texas Intermediate hit $130.50/barrel, both at their highest since July 2008. Russia is the world's second-largest crude exporter.

307.title: Delhi Transport Minister launches 100 new AC CNG buses today
307.article_body: Delhi Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot launched 100 more air-conditioned low-floor buses, which will run on compressed natural gas (CNG) and a new electric bus from the Delhi Transport Corporation's (DTC) Indraprastha depot today. The new AC CNG buses will include facilities such as CCTV cameras, panic buttons for women's safety and more, according to transport officials.

308.title: Last batch of 6,177 evacuated Indian students arrive from Budapest
308.article_body: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri along with the last batch of 6,177 Indian students from Budapest reached Delhi on Monday. "There is joy, enthusiasm and relief as youngsters reach home and will soon be with their parents and families," Puri wrote on Twitter. Over 16,000 Indian students have been evacuated from Ukraine over the past week.

309.title: Ex-NSE CEO Chitra refused to identify former colleague Subramanian: CBI tells court
309.article_body: The CBI has been granted seven-day custody of former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna in the co-location case after she was arrested on Sunday. The CBI had sought 14-day custody from the court arguing that Ramkrishna had been evasive in her replies and despite being confronted with her former colleague Anand Subramanian, a co-accused, she "refused to even identify him."

310.title: Ukraine's fight against Russia an inspiration for us: Taiwan minister
310.article_body: Ukrainians fighting the Russian invasion of their country are an inspiration for the Taiwanese people, Taiwan Foreign Minister Joseph Wu said on Monday. Wu added that Taiwan has raised over $10.6 million (over ₹81 crore) in donations to help displaced Ukrainians. Additionally, Taiwanese leaders, including President Tsai, had contributed a month's pay towards humanitarian efforts in Ukraine.

311.title: Man held for allegedly trying to run over judge's wife in Ayodhya
311.article_body: A 45-year-old man was arrested after he allegedly tried to run over a judge's wife and driver following an argument over parking in Ayodhya. The driver alleged that "when they reached the school to pick judge's daughter, the accused attempted to run over them in his SUV". A case was lodged against Manuj Malhotra on charges of attempt to murder.

312.title: I don't think I've ability to write, I'm fascinated by people who can: Shahid
312.article_body: When asked whether he has thought about writing or directing a film just like his father Pankaj Kapur, actor Shahid Kapoor said, "I don't think I have the ability to write. I'm fascinated by people who can." "As for direction, I am very focussed on what I am doing...I am not ready to give up acting right now," Shahid added.

313.title: We have ensured that Fadnavis never return as CM: Sharad Pawar
313.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar took a dig at former Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis at an event in Osmanabad. "Some people don't know that politics should not be done during difficult times. Before elections, only he [Fadnavis] was saying that he will be back as CM," Pawar said. "Now, we have ensured that he will never return as CM," added Pawar.

314.title: Mumbai Police arrest gangster with 37 cases against him in B'luru
314.article_body: A man with 37 cases registered against him including serious offences such as murder, has been arrested from Bengaluru, Karnataka. The Criminal Intelligence Unit (CIU) of the Mumbai crime branch arrested Iliyas Abdul Aziz Khan alias Iliyas Bachakana from a hotel in Hosur after he was found hiding there. Other cases against him include attempt to murder, robbery and extortion.

315.title: Radhe Shyam isn't inspired by Titanic, it's a different story: Pooja Hegde
315.article_body: Speaking about the comparisons between her film 'Radhe Shyam' and 'Titanic', actress Pooja Hegde said that it's a big compliment to achieve that scale and be like it. She added, "But, Radhe Shyam is not inspired by Titanic. It's a different story." "The only similarity is the ship in the middle of the sea, and something is happening," Pooja said.

316.title: S Korean actress Han So-hee's agency responds to mom's fraud case
316.article_body: South Korean actress Han So-hee's agency responded to fraud case involving her mother, stating she won't take responsibility for the debt. Her mother had opened a bank account in her name when she was a minor and used it to borrow money without her knowledge. "There was even a case involving the forgery of a private document," the agency stated.

317.title: Shabana shares pic of Javed's 'cluttered' desk, says he uses trolley to write on
317.article_body: Shabana Azmi took to Instagram and shared a picture of Javed Akhtar's "cluttered" study table. "Javed's study. Always so cluttered that he has to use a food trolley (peaking from right-hand corner) to write on instead of his desk," she wrote. Reacting to her post, a user wrote, "The genius' desk," while another user wrote, "I'm feeling dizzy looking at...table."

318.title: Actors have come & gone, junior artists remain in every frame: Big B
318.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan took to his blog to praise the work of junior artists in the film industry, writing, "Actors and actresses have come and gone but they remain in every frame!" The actor shared a series of pictures showing his interaction with the artists. He further wrote that some of them have been around since before he began his journey.

319.title: ED, CBI take action on people before they join BJP: Mumbai Mayor
319.article_body: Mumbai Mayor Kishori Pednekar criticised BJP for allegedly using central agencies to settle political scores. "ED, CBI and IT Dept take action against people and if they join BJP, they get clean," said Pednekar. The reaction is part of her verbal spat with BJP MLA Nitesh Rane who was recently interrogated by Mumbai Police in connection with Disha Salian's death.

320.title: Microplastics found in fish caught off Mumbai coast: Study
320.article_body: Researchers have found microplastics less than 100 microns in size in gastrointestinal tracts and gills of croaker fish caught off Mumbai’s coast. According to the Central Institute of Fisheries Education (CIFE) research, the microplastics found in fish tissue were predominantly black and blue in colour. It poses a carcinogenic risk to consumers and organisms in food chain, the study added.

321.title: MG introduces the all-new ZS EV seeking to change mindsets about EVs
321.article_body: The recently launched ZS EV features a 50.3 kWh advanced battery with 176PS of power and driving range of 461 km* in a single charge, MG revealed. It is equipped with LED headlamps, a 10.1” HD infotainment screen, and digital Bluetooth key while its advanced safety package includes blind-spot detection, lane change assist and rear cross-traffic alert.

322.title: 10 students of UP polytechnic college injured in gas cylinder blast at hostel
322.article_body: Ten students were injured in a gas cylinder explosion inside the hostel of a government polytechnic college in Uttar Pradesh's Bulandshahr on Monday, police said. The incident took place when a five-kilogram cylinder exploded while food was being cooked inside the kitchen, police added. Bulandshahr DM said the injured persons have been sent to a government medical college in Aligarh.

323.title: Anamika is my evil twin: Madhuri on her character in 'The Fame Game'
323.article_body: When asked about her character 'Anamika Anand' in show 'The Fame Game', actress Madhuri Dixit said her on-screen character differs from her real self. Madhuri added 'Anamika' wouldn't be able to deal with things as she does. "She'd be a mess if she walks into a room and nobody recognises her, she'll go mad. She's...my evil twin," Madhuri said.

324.title: Capt Amarinder Singh meets Amit Shah ahead of Punjab polls result
324.article_body: Punjab Lok Congress President Captain Amarinder Singh met Union Home Minister Amit Shah in Delhi on Monday. When quipped on the alliance's performance in Punjab assembly elections, Singh said, "My party and BJP has done well. Let us see what happens." The PLC is in an alliance with BJP along with Shiromani Akali Dal (Sanyukt) for the Punjab polls.

325.title: Traffic rules' violators in Noida to get e-fines from April 15
325.article_body: Commuters violating traffic rules in Noida will be issued electronic fines from April 15, 2022, as part of the Noida authority's intelligent traffic management system (ITMS) project. A budget of ₹64.49 crore has been set aside for the project, which will put 84 traffic intersections under e-surveillance in the city with a total of 1,065 cameras, officials said.

326.title: Ukraine rejects humanitarian corridors leading to Russia & Belarus, calls it 'immoral'
326.article_body: Ukraine has rejected humanitarian corridors proposed by Russia that allowed people to exit to Russia and Belarus. President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's spokesperson called the move "immoral" and said Russia was trying to "use people's suffering to create a television picture". "They are citizens of Ukraine, they should have the right to evacuate to the territory of Ukraine," the spokesperson added.

327.title: What is the co-location case for which ex-NSE CEO Chitra has been arrested?
327.article_body: The NSE co-location case refers to a series of events wherein some brokers received preferential access through the co-location facility, resulting in faster access to the markets. The matter came to light after a whistleblower wrote to SEBI in 2015. The NSE co-location facilities were launched in 2009 while Chitra Ramkrishna was appointed as the Joint MD the same year.

328.title: Want him to go through journey without my backing: Salil Ankola on son's career
328.article_body: Actor Salil Ankola said he wants his son Karan Ankola to go through the journey of making his career without his backing. "When you achieve success after struggling for it relentlessly, you feel proud of yourself. I am very happy that his efforts are always getting noticed and appreciated," 'The Power' actor said.

329.title: IMD predicts overcast weather, rainfall in Delhi on March 9-10
329.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted overcast weather and light rainfall in Delhi on March 9 and 10. During this period, light rainfall is also expected in districts of Punjab and Haryana. The rainfall will be due to the western disturbance that is likely to affect the Western Himalayan region from the night of March 8.

330.title: Kangana celebrates 8 yrs of 'Queen'; shares old pic with Virat, Dhoni
330.article_body: Kangana Ranaut took to Instagram Stories on Monday to share a post celebrating eight years of her film 'Queen'. She shared a throwback picture, wherein she's seen doing a step from the song 'London Thumakda' with Virat Kohli, MS Dhoni, Ajinkya Rahane, Ravichandran Ashwin and Stuart Binny. "On this day...a film came called Queen...and it changed my life," Kangana wrote.

331.title: May God keep you safe: Kirron Kher wishes husband Anupam on 67th b'day
331.article_body: Actor-politician Kirron Kher wished her husband-actor, Anupam Kher, on his 67th birthday. Taking to Instagram, Kirron shared a picture with Anupam from an event and captioned it, "Many many happy returns of the day dearest @anupampkher, husband, friend, support and my love. God bless you and keep you safe and healthy always."

332.title: Warne's cricket knowledge separated him from everyone else: Clarke
332.article_body: Talking about Shane Warne, who passed away aged 52 on Friday, former Australia captain Michael Clarke told The Sydney Morning Herald, "Warne's knowledge around the game separated him from everyone else I played with." "Warne lived his life at such a fast pace that he nearly created this invincible feeling around him," he added.

333.title: Was told I'll be made Prez if I didn't speak in favour of protesting farmers: Malik
333.article_body: Meghalaya Governor Satya Pal Malik has claimed that 'some of his friends' in the BJP told him that he will be given the post of India's President if he didn't speak in support of farmers protesting against the three farm laws. "They tried to lure me...but I turned down all their proposals and spoke in favour of farmers," said Malik.

334.title: People say, 'Oh God, we want to work you' and then nothing happens: Shefali
334.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah said she gets a lot of appreciation for her performances but that doesn't translate into work offers. She added, "[People say] 'Oh god we want to work with you'. 'Really? I want to work with you too' and then nothing happens." "Then I see [them] at...next party and say the exactly same thing...It's really boring," she said.

335.title: South African cricketers face test of loyalty ahead of IPL: Elgar
335.article_body: South Africa Test skipper Dean Elgar said his teammates need to choose between national duty in a series against Bangladesh, beginning March 18, and upcoming IPL as it's a loyalty test for them. "They mustn't forget that Test...or one-day cricket got them into...IPL and not...other way around," he added. Series will end on April 12. IPL begins on March 26.

336.title: Close friends Viv Richards, Ian Botham unveil trophy for WI-England Tests
336.article_body: Former competitors and close friends Sir Vivian Richards and Ian Botham unveiled the Richards-Botham Trophy for the upcoming Test series between the West Indies and England on Sunday. The Cricket West Indies tweeted, "Courage. Friendship. Respect. - values that represent the cricketing Test rivalry between West Indies and England." Both of them played together for the Somerset CCC.

337.title: Stalker attacks woman with acid for rejecting his advances in Guj
337.article_body: A 39-year-old woman was attacked with acid after she allegedly rejected the advances of a stalker in Gujarat's Ahmedabad on Sunday. The accused, an autorickshaw driver, used to drop the woman at her workplace so they'd shared numbers, a police official said. The accused stalked the woman after she left her workplace then threw acid, the police official added.

338.title: Virat Kohli developed the Indian pace bowling attack: Gambhir
338.article_body: Ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir said that Virat Kohli developed the Indian pace bowling attack, adding Kohli has passed on a better fast bowling combination to captain Rohit Sharma than what the ex-captain got from MS Dhoni. "Their actual development, whether it was related to fitness or skill- Umesh Yadav or Mohammad Shami...I'm sure that would've been Kohli's thinking," he added.

339.title: PM inaugurates art gallery dedicated to cartoonist RK Laxman in Pune
339.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday virtually inaugurated a modern art gallery-cum-museum in Pune dedicated to cartoonist RK Laxman, who is best known for his creation 'The Common Man'. The gallery has a miniature model based on the village of Malgudi. The art gallery also has over 30,000 sketches made by Laxman.

340.title: Ashwin comes into every series with different thinking: Sanjay Bangar
340.article_body: Former Team India batting coach Sanjay Bangar has said that his biggest challenge with off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin was that the 35-year-old came into every series with different thinking. "If we see the last two years, there was a time when he tried to bowl a lot with a front-on action...but [against Sri Lanka] he was bowling absolutely side-on," Bangar explained.

341.title: BSF jawan shoots himself after killing colleague at camp in West Bengal
341.article_body: A Border Security Force (BSF) jawan allegedly shot himself after killing his colleague at a camp in West Bengal's Murshidabad district on Monday, officials said. The duo got into a scuffle after receiving summons from the local police, according to officials. This comes a day after five BSF personnel were killed in a fratricide incident at a camp in Amritsar.

342.title: Second edition of Durgam Cheruvu marathon held in Hyderabad
342.article_body: The second edition of the Durgam Cheruvu marathon was held in Hyderabad on Sunday. The marathon was organised by Inorbit Mall in Hyderabad and inaugurated by MAUD Special Chief Secretary Arvind Kumar. Over 3,500 people had registered to run in the marathon this year, Kumar tweeted while sharing pictures from the event.

343.title: Alia in talks with Rajamouli for his next film with Mahesh Babu: Report
343.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt is in talks with 'RRR' director SS Rajamouli for his upcoming jungle adventure featuring Mahesh Babu in the lead role, according to a report. "Unlike 'RRR', Alia will be having a bigger role in this African jungle adventure," Pinkvilla said quoting a source. 'RRR', starring Jr NTR and Ram Charan, features Alia in an extended cameo appearance.

344.title: Shane Warne died of natural causes, shows autopsy
344.article_body: Former Australia cricketer Shane Warne, who passed away on an island in Thailand on Friday, died due to natural causes, an autopsy showed. "Investigators will summarize the autopsy result for prosecutors within the timeframe of the law," the police said. Warne's family were told of the result and had accepted the finding, the police added.

345.title: Shane Warne's last meal was Vegemite on toast, reveals friend; shares pics
345.article_body: Shane Warne's friend Tom Hall, who is the CEO of The Sporting News, revealed that Warne's last meal was Vegemite on toast. "[While eating] Warne said, 'Geez, you can’t beat Vegemite with some butter, always great wherever you are in the world'," Hall revealed. Hall added that Warne went to bedroom to call his kids after having the meal.

346.title: I don't think Virat Kohli will captain RCB again: Daniel Vettori
346.article_body: Ahead of IPL 2022, former RCB captain Daniel Vettori said, "I don't think Virat Kohli will captain RCB again." He added that Faf du Plessis, Dinesh Karthik, Glenn Maxwell and Kohli could form RCB's leadership group. "I don't think [becoming captain again after giving up captaincy] ever works. Once...captain has moved on...the right thing is for him to move on."

347.title: Sensex ends nearly 1,500 points lower at 52,842, Nifty settles below 15,900
347.article_body: The Sensex plunged 1,491 points to close at 52,842 while the Nifty settled at 15,863 after falling 382 points on Monday amid weak global cues. The sharp fall comes as crude oil prices surged past the $130-per-barrel mark amid heightened tensions between Russia and Ukraine. Metal index gained over 2%, while auto, bank, FMCG, PSU bank and realty fell 2-5%.

348.title: 188 Chhattisgarh students have returned from Ukraine: State govt
348.article_body: As many as 188 students from Chhattisgarh who were in Ukraine have returned to India, state government said on Sunday. Students are being provided food and lodging in Delhi and will be given tickets to return to their hometowns, an official said. Efforts were made to stay in touch with stranded students since February 22, Chhattisgarh's Joint Resident Commissioner said.

349.title: ITBP troops help elderly voters during UP polls; video surfaces
