349.article_body: Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) on Monday shared a video of its troops helping elderly and differently-abled voters cast their votes during the 7th phase of the Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections. The troops were seen helping voters at polling booths in Varanasi, Jaunpur and Sonbhadra, among others. The video shows personnel helping elderly people who'd arrived at polling booths on wheelchairs.

350.title: India Women played the sort of match they were expecting vs Pak: Gambhir
350.article_body: Following a 107-run win over Pakistan in the Women's ODI World Cup on Sunday, ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir said India Women played the sort of match they were expecting. "You want to play such...match at the start where your...batting order is tested, your capability is tested...you're also tested in the bowling department because it wasn't a huge total," Gambhir stated.

351.title: Test series vs WI isn't going to be easy for us: England's Woakes
351.article_body: England fast bowler Chris Woakes said that the three-match Test series against West Indies is not going to be easy for his side. "We haven't won a lot of Test matches here in the last 50 or 60 years...so it's not by any means going to be a walkover," he added. The first Test match will be played in Antigua.

352.title: Man molests 5-yr-old girl in Pune, threatens her to keep quiet; held
352.article_body: The Pimpri-Chinchwad Police arrested a 40-year-old man for allegedly molesting minor girls. The incident came to light when the mother of a victim lodged complaint with police on Sunday. The accused molested the five-year-old girl by touching her inappropriately and also threatened her to keep quiet about the incident. He had also molested another six-year-old girl about a week ago.

353.title: 21 kg ganja worth ₹4 lakh seized from train passenger in Bengaluru
353.article_body: Around 21 kg ganja estimated to be valued at ₹4 lakh was seized from a passenger on Kakinada Express after it reached the Bengaluru Cantonment Railway Station, the Government Railway Police, Karnataka said. The passenger was carrying 16 kg of the contraband in a suitcase and 5 kg of it in another travel bag. Police said he has been arrested.

354.title: China will provide humanitarian aid to Ukraine: Foreign Minister
354.article_body: China will send humanitarian aid to Ukraine very soon, Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi said on Monday, while adding that China's ties with Russia are "rock solid". Yi said "humanitarian action" must abide by principles of neutrality and impartiality. Notably, China has refused to call Russia's attack on Ukraine an 'invasion' and asked West to address its "legitimate security concerns".

355.title: NZ players to miss Netherlands series for IPL 2022: NZ head coach
355.article_body: New Zealand head coach Gary Stead confirmed that New Zealand players, who are part of the IPL franchises, will be available for IPL 2022. "They won't be available for the Netherlands series," Stead added. New Zealand will host the Netherlands for one T20I and three ODIs. The tour will begin with T20I which will be played on March 25.

356.title: Open to post-poll alliance with non-BJP parties: Cong’s ahead of Goa poll results
356.article_body: Ahead of the Goa Assembly poll results, Congress said it is open to a post-poll alliance with parties other than BJP to form the next government if it doesn’t get a majority on its own. AICC’s Goa desk in-charge, Dinesh Gundu Rao, said Congress is open to seeking the support of parties like AAP, MGP and TMC to form government.

357.title: German woman spends 40 seconds alone in ambulance carrying Warne's body, police to probe
357.article_body: Thai police are investigating after a German woman got into the back of the ambulance transporting the body of late Australian cricketer Shane Warne from Koh Samui island. The woman, carrying a bunch of flowers, was allowed to spend about 40 seconds alone in the van, raising questions about security. Warne's friends in Thailand reportedly couldn't identify the woman.

358.title: Ashneer tried to create a false narrative about BharatPe: Co-founder Shashvat
358.article_body: BharatPe's Co-founder Shashvat Nakrani in a letter to the company's employees said, "Ashneer Grover tried to create a false narrative about the company that we've built together with the right spirit." He added, "I am proud of the fact that our board acted quickly and decisively to uphold good corporate governance." BharatPe removed Ashneer from all positions on March 2.

359.title: 8 including 2 women injured as 2 groups clash with lathis, stones in UP
359.article_body: Eight persons, including two women, were injured in a clash between two groups in Uttar Pradesh's Shamli district, police said on Monday. According to police, the incident took place when one group confronted two persons for allegedly harassing a woman. The situation turned violent after the two groups clashed with lathis and stones, police added.

360.title: PM speaks to Putin for 50 minutes, urges direct talks with Ukrainian Prez: Report
360.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday spoke on the phone with Russian President Vladimir Putin on the situation in Ukraine and the call lasted around 50 minutes, ANI reported. Putin briefed PM Modi about the status of negotiations between Ukrainian and Russian teams and PM urged President Putin to hold direct talks with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, it further reported.

361.title: Former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna sent to 7-day CBI custody in co-location scam
361.article_body: A Delhi court granted the CBI seven-day custodial interrogation of former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna in the co-location case on Monday. The probe agency had sought 14-day custody of Ramkrishna, who is also accused of sharing confidential information with a 'Himalayan yogi'. She was arrested by the CBI in Delhi on Sunday, a day after her anticipatory bail was denied.

362.title: 30 of 36 disputed villages along Meghalaya-Assam border to remain in Meghalaya: CM
362.article_body: Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma on Monday informed the Assembly that 30 of the 36 disputed villages along the Meghalaya-Assam border will remain in Meghalaya, as recommended by regional committees of the two states. "Ownership of land, however, will not be affected after demarcation of the boundary," Sangma said. The 30 villages cover an area of 18 square kilometres.

363.title: I don't chew tobacco, had to put cotton in mouth for 'Love Hostel' role: Bobby
363.article_body: Bobby Deol has said the most challenging part of playing Dagar in 'Love Hostel' was the language. "I'd to learn Haryanvi...I'd to get it right," he added. Bobby further said he also had to use a lot of prosthetics. "Since this character chews tobacco (I don't) I'd to put cotton in my mouth to look as I do," said Bobby.

364.title: Russia-Ukraine conflict moment of choice for China: Australia PM
364.article_body: Australian PM Scott Morrison said on Monday that the Russia and Ukraine conflict is a "moment of choice for China". He added that the world has heard China's words about its "commitment to global peace and respect for sovereignty" and now it is time for the country to demonstrate it. He also urged China to put sanctions on Russia.

365.title: Pune's SPPU likely to restart heritage tour to underground tunnel
365.article_body: The Savitribai Phule Pune University is likely to restart the guided heritage tour to the underground tunnel at the university, officials said. The tour was discontinued for over two years due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The tunnel was discovered during the restoration work of the main building in 2018.

366.title: Microsoft to set up its largest Indian data centre region in Hyderabad
366.article_body: Microsoft on Monday said it plans to establish its largest Indian data centre region in Hyderabad, with its first phase expected to become operational by 2025. Microsoft India President Anant Maheshwari said the company is making long-term investments and that it has doubled its existing three data centres' capacity. “We already serve more than 3,40,000 companies in India,” he said.

367.title: Elections for 13 Rajya Sabha seats to be held on March 31: EC
367.article_body: Elections for 13 Rajya Sabha seats will be held on March 31 this year, the Election Commission announced on Monday. The seats are spread across six states – five in Punjab, three in Kerala, two in Assam and one each in Himachal Pradesh, Tripura, and Nagaland. The term of office of 13 RS members is due to expire in April.

368.title: Hope to be half as great as you: Masaba on dad Vivian Richard's 70th b'day
368.article_body: Fashion designer Masaba Gupta wished her father, former West Indies cricketer Vivian Richards on his 70th birthday and shared a throwback picture with him. Taking to Instagram, Masaba wrote, "My father is unrelenting [and] focussed...[He] has lived his life in the pursuit of greatness...I set out in my pursuit to be even half as great as you...Happy 70th birthday papa!"

369.title: I hope Ashwin breaks Kumble's record of 619 Test wickets: Nikhil Chopra
369.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Nikhil Chopra has said he wants off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin to break Anil Kumble's record of being the top wicket-taker for India in Tests. "Kumble would be [himself] wishing that a spinner breaks his record. Just like Kumble, Ashwin has developed a reputation to win matches for the team at home," Nikhil added. Currently, Ashwin has 436 Test wickets.

370.title: Taron Egerton faints during performance in London, says he's 'completely fine'
370.article_body: Actor Taron Egerton fainted during the maiden performance of his new play in London. Reports said that a doctor from the crowd rushed to the stage to help the 32-year-old actor. The play's director assured the audience actor was "absolutely fine". However, he could not continue the performance. Egerton shared an update on Instagram, saying he is "completely fine".

371.title: Captain Fresh doubles valuation in 3 months as it raises $50 mn
371.article_body: Business-to-business (B2B) seafood marketplace Captain Fresh has more than doubled its valuation to $500 million in three months after raising $50 million in Series C funding round. Co-led by Prosus Ventures and Tiger Global, it saw participation from existing investors Accel India, Matrix Partners India, Ankur Capital and Incubate Fund. The startup was valued at about $200 million in December.

372.title: Delhi High Court dismisses plea for virtual court proceedings
372.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Monday dismissed a plea seeking direction to take sufficient steps to adopt virtual court proceedings through video conferencing as a norm. The counsels, litigations, parties and courts should be at liberty to proceed in any matter through virtual courts if the physical appearance is not really necessary, the plea stated.

373.title: Clothing is a necessity, Russians have right to live: Uniqlo as it stays open in Russia
373.article_body: Fast Retailing, the parent company of Japanese clothing brand Uniqlo, on Monday defended its decision to keep the Russian stores open amid rival brands suspending operations in the country over the invasion of Ukraine. Tadashi Yanai, President of Fast Retailing, said, "Clothing is a necessity of life. The people of Russia have the same right to live as we do."

374.title: Pornographic content found in phone of Chhattisgarh journalist held over fake news
374.article_body: The Chhattisgarh Police has claimed to have found "pornographic content and sensitive confidential documents" from the phone of a Raipur-based journalist, who was recently arrested for allegedly spreading fake news against ruling Congress leaders. Police alleged that the chats recovered from his phone were found to be objectionable, abusive and also of the nature of intimidation.

375.title: Was told I'd get Prez post if I didn't speak on farmers' issue: Malik
375.article_body: Meghalaya Governor Satya Pal Malik claimed on Sunday while addressing a gathering in Haryana's Jind that he was told that he'd be given the President post if he didn't speak on the farmers' issue. "I turned down all their proposals...These posts of governor and president are nothing," he said. He also urged farmers to unite and form their own government.

376.title: Mumbai to get 25 new bus routes to improve connectivity with metro
376.article_body: Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) plans to introduce 25 new bus routes for passengers of Dahisar and DN Nagar Metro 2-A line to improve metro's last mile connectivity. BEST also plans to relocate some bus stands and stops between Dahisar and Andheri closer to the metro stations. BEST may introduce 175 new routes as other metro corridors become operational.

377.title: B'luru women take out rally for fundamental rights amid hijab issue
377.article_body: Several women took out a march in Bengaluru for women's right to education, dignity and choice amid the hijab controversy on Sunday. The rally began from the Café Coffee Day Square on Vittal Mallya Road and ended at Town Hall with the protesters. Some women were dressed as social reformers Fatima Sheikh and Savitribai Phule.

378.title: 'President Zelensky Way' sign posted outside Russian Embassy in US, pic goes viral
378.article_body: A photo of a road sign reading 'President Zelensky Way' outside the Russian Embassy on Wisconsin Avenue, Washington, DC has gone viral on social media. Activists placed the sign outside the Russian Embassy on Sunday afternoon in honour of Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. Notably, Zelenskyy had earlier refused US offer to evacuate him, saying "I need ammunition, not a ride."

379.title: Netflix suspends its services, TikTok blocks new uploads in Russia
379.article_body: Netflix has announced that it is suspending its services in Russia after the country launched the invasion of Ukraine. Additionally, China's ByteDance-owned TikTok is blocking livestreaming and uploading of new content after Russia passed a law criminalising spreading of "fake news" about its army. Netflix earlier said it was temporarily stopping all future projects and acquisitions in Russia.

380.title: Informed PM Modi about Ukraine countering Russia, grateful for support: Zelenskyy
380.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday said he informed Indian PM Narendra Modi about "Ukraine countering Russian aggression" after reports said the two leaders spoke on the phone. "India appreciates the assistance to its citizens during the war and Ukraine's commitment to direct peaceful dialogue at the highest level. Grateful for the support to the Ukrainian people," said Zelenskyy.

381.title: Indian rupee hits its lowest level against the US dollar
381.article_body: The Indian rupee hit its lowest level against the US dollar as it opened at ₹76.96 on Monday compared to a close of ₹76.17 on Friday. The rupee's previous low was at ₹76.91 in April 2020. The sharp fall comes amid soaring oil prices following the Russia-Ukraine conflict and continued outflows of foreign portfolio money.

382.title: I suffer from an ailment called onomatomania: Naseeruddin Shah
382.article_body: Actor Naseeruddin Shah, while speaking to YouTube channel Chalchitra Talks, revealed that he suffers from a condition called 'onomatomania'. The 71-year-old actor said, "Onomatomania is an ailment in which you keep repeating a word, a phrase, a sentence, a verse, or an entire speech for no reason at all." He added, "I do that all the time."

383.title: New Zealand defeat B'desh by 9 wickets to register their 1st win in Women's WC
383.article_body: New Zealand registered their first victory of ICC Women's ODI World Cup 2022 with a nine-wicket win against Bangladesh in a rain-affected match on Monday. Amy Satterthwaite picked three wickets as hosts New Zealand restricted Bangladesh to 140/8 in 27 overs. In response, Suzie Bates smashed 79* off 68 to help her side win the match.

384.title: 2.5 acres of forest in Karnataka's Bandipur Tiger Reserve gutted in fire
384.article_body: Over 2.5 acres of forest in Bandipur Tiger Reserve in the Chamarajanagar district of Karnataka was gutted in a fire that broke out on Sunday afternoon, forest officials said. According to officials, the blaze was brought under control and no wildlife was affected. The forest department has deployed 400 additional forest guards after the fire.

385.title: Man kills self in lockup after being caught with 7 stolen phones in Punjab
385.article_body: A day after he was caught with seven stolen mobile phones in Ludhiana, Ashish Kumar, of Punjab's Jalandhar, died by suicide in the lockup at Salem Tabri police station on Sunday. Kumar was rushed to the hospital where he was declared dead. A case was registered against Kumar under Section 379B of the IPC.

386.title: Anonymous hacks Russian streaming services, shows war footage from Ukraine
386.article_body: Hacker collective Anonymous on Monday hacked into streaming services and TV news channels in Russia to broadcast footage of the ongoing war in Ukraine. Anonymous tweeted that it hacked into streaming services Wink and Ivi (like Netflix) and live TV channels Russia 24, Channel One and Moscow 24. The footage called for Russians to oppose the attack in Ukraine.

387.title: Boney compares Hindi cinema to fast food, says 'South films offer thali'
387.article_body: When asked if Bollywood is being overshadowed by South cinema, producer Boney Kapoor said South films are a complete package of a family drama.  He added, "Today, some of the Mumbai filmmakers serve...KFC...where you get only what you order, whereas...South [films] offer you thali with roti, dal-chawal...chicken." "Most...South films are made for the Indian audience," Boney said.

388.title: Shreyas Talpade to play Pravin Tambe in cricketer's biopic
388.article_body: Shreyas Talpade will portray Mumbai's leg-spinner Pravin Tambe in a film based on the life of the cricketer. Titled 'Kaun Pravin Tambe?', the upcoming film will release on an OTT platform on April 1. Speaking about the film, Pravin said, "My family and loved ones can't wait to see my story come alive...it's going to be a very special day."

389.title: Man Utd didn't create many problems and we played good: City coach Guardiola
389.article_body: Manchester City head coach Pep Guardiola has praised his side for "excellent display" in their 4-1 win against Manchester United. "I'm the biggest critic of my team, but [against United] we played really good. We struggled to make a better build up [in the first half] but I don't think they created many problems," he added.

390.title: Indian students were protesting in Ukraine, PM was playing damru: Saamana
390.article_body: Shiv Sena's mouthpiece Saamana said while Indian students were protesting in Sumy, Kyiv and Kharkiv in Ukraine, Prime Minister Modi was playing 'damru' on banks of river Ganga in Varanasi. It also reportedly said, "If this is what 'Operation Ganga' means then we bow before them." "We will also raise slogans in praise of you...keep politics aside for a while."

391.title: MG introduces the all-new ZS EV seeking to change mindsets about EVs
391.article_body: The recently launched ZS EV features a 50.3 kWh advanced battery with 176PS of power and driving range of 461 km* in a single charge, MG revealed. It is equipped with LED headlamps, a 25.7 cm HD infotainment screen, and digital Bluetooth key while its advanced safety package includes blind-spot detection, lane change assist and rear cross-traffic alert.

392.title: Ukraine evacuation named 'Op Ganga' as Varanasi is undergoing voting: Akhilesh
392.article_body: The operation to evacuate Indians from Ukraine was named "Operation Ganga" as Varanasi is also undergoing voting in UP Assembly polls, SP chief, Akhilesh Yadav, said. "Don't know which international recognition they boast about. They (BJP-led Centre) failed to evacuate Indians," Yadav added. "Had they rescued our people from Ukraine directly I would've appreciated it," Yadav stated.

393.title: Union Min launches 'Donate-a-Pension' scheme, donates to gardener
393.article_body: Union Labour Minister Bhupender Yadav on Monday launched the 'Donate-a-Pension' programme under the Pradhan Mantri Shram Yogi Maan-Dhan (PM-SYM) at his residence by donating to the gardener. The scheme allows people to donate a premium contribution to their support staff's pension fund. Under the PM-SYM, people receive an assured pension of a minimum of ₹3,000/month after the age of 60.

394.title: Ukrainians have plans in place: US on if Russia kills Ukraine President Zelenskyy
394.article_body: Ukraine has a contingency plan in case President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is killed by Russia, US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said. "The Ukrainians have plans in place - that I'm not going to talk about or get into any details on - to make sure there is what we would call 'continuity of government' one way or another," he said.

395.title: Ukrainian man, who attended Russia-Ukraine peace talks, found dead amid claims of spying
395.article_body: Denis Kireev, a member of Ukraine's negotiating team during first round of peace talks with Russia, was found dead amid claims he was a spy. Ukraine's Ministry of Defence said the 45-year-old was killed during an operation to "defend the nation" but some Ukrainian MPs claimed he was killed by Ukraine's security service after resisting arrest on suspicion of treason.

396.title: Union Minister calls Rahul Gandhi's tweets as 'a bundle of lies'
396.article_body: Union Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai has hit back at Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for criticising the Centre's evacuation efforts to bring back the Indians stranded in war-torn Ukraine. "Rahul Gandhi's tweet does not make any sense. It's a bundle of lies," he said, adding that PM Modi's efforts are being lauded by everyone.

397.title: Nitin Mukesh remembers Lata on 1-month death anniversary, shares old pics
397.article_body: Neil Nitin Mukesh's father and singer Nitin Mukesh took to Instagram on Sunday to remember Lata Mangeshkar on her one-month death anniversary. Sharing a few pictures with the late veteran singer, he wrote, "One month passed like one era. I love my didi." Lata passed away aged 92 due to multi-organ failure after being hospitalised for nearly a month.

398.title: Alia Bhatt, Ranveer Singh, Nia Sharma attend ITA awards 2022, pics surface
398.article_body: Several celebrities including actors Alia Bhatt, Ranveer Singh, Rashami Desai, Rakhi Sawant and Nia Sharma attended the 21st Indian Television Academy Awards, also known as ITA Awards, which was held in Mumbai on March 6, 2022. While Rakhi danced with Ranveer Singh on the red carpet. Alia Bhatt attended the event and greeted the paparazzi with her Gangubai Kathiawadi-style namaste.

399.title: BJP MLAs protest against MVA govt, demand Nawab Malik’s resignation
399.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) MLAs staged a protest at Maharashtra Assembly in Mumbai against the MVA government, demanding the resignation of state minister Nawab Malik. Earlier, former CM Devendra Fadnavis accused the state government of protecting Malik. Malik was arrested in connection with a money laundering case linked to gangster Dawood Ibrahim.

400.title: Mumbai to get 'sister city square' to honour bond with 15 sister cities around world
400.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to set up a 'sister city square' at Bandra Kurla Complex in a bid to honour the relationship between Mumbai and its 15 'sister cities' around the world. "The idea is to create a space where domestic and foreign tourists can visit, spend time, and interact with their peers," a civic official said.

401.title: 19-yr-old Srinagar woman injured during grenade attack dies; death toll reaches 2
401.article_body: A 19-year-old woman, who was injured in a grenade attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar, passed away at a hospital on Monday morning. Two persons, including a 79-year-old man, have died because of the blast so far and at least 23 others have sustained injuries. Terrorists had reportedly lobbed a grenade in a busy marketplace near Amira Kadal on Sunday.

402.title: Almost 21,000 people including PM Modi travelled in Pune Metro on Day 1
402.article_body: On its inaugural day, the Pune Metro saw almost 21,000 people taking a ride in it, including Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Currently operating on only two routes, the Garware college-Vanaz station route witnessed 15,842 commuters while the PCMC-Phugewadi station route had 4,616 passengers. Both routes have five stations each and cover a combined distance of 12 km.

403.title: Ashwin's impact has been close to that of Kapil Dev: Gautam Gambhir
403.article_body: Former India opener Gautam Gambhir has said Ravichandran Ashwin's impact as an all-rounder has been "close to that of Kapil Dev". "He has scored five Test hundreds although I don't want to go with stats," added Gambhir. Ashwin scored 61 runs in India's first innings in the first Test against Sri Lanka and also picked six wickets in the match.

404.title: Can state's ₹500, 1000 cure us: Man who pulled cart to UP poll booth
404.article_body: A man reached polling booth in Uttar Pradesh's Azamgarh by pulling cart. His wife who had fracture and handicapped woman were sitting on cart. "I've back problem...and my wife is also not well...[we] used this cart. We've no expectations. Can ₹500, 1000 [given by state] cure us?" he asked. The couple said they did not want to waste their votes.

405.title: Kerala woman alleges tattoo artist raped her after putting needle in her spine
405.article_body: An 18-year-old woman has alleged that tattoo artist Sujeesh PS raped her after putting a needle into her spine in Kerala. She wrote on social media, "I just felt like dying right there on the spot for being so stupid. I felt disgusted." Sujeesh was arrested on Saturday after at least six other women filed sexual assault complaints against him.
